section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
b

subsection.def: China National Intellectual Property Administration (國家知識產權局) means the China National Intellectual Property Administration established under the laws of the People’s Republic of China the functions of which include the granting of patents for inventions; (21 of 2024 s. 48)
digital signature (數碼簽署) has the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 37 of 2004)
electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 37 of 2004)
electronic signature (電子簽署) has the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 37 of 2004)
European Patent Office (歐洲專利局) means the office of that name of the European Patent Organization established by the Convention on the Grant of European Patents done at Munich on 5 October 1973;
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 37 of 2004)

International Patent Classification (國際專利分類法) means the system of common classification for patents for inventions provided for under the Agreement concerning the International Patent Classification done at Strasbourg on 24 March 1971, as revised or amended from time to time; (L.N. 37 of 2004)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a document published under the Ordinance, the number assigned to the document by the Registrar upon its publication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a document published under the laws of a patent office outside Hong Kong or under any international convention, the number assigned to the document upon its publication by that patent office or under that convention;

subsection.def: send (送交) includes give, and cognate expressions are to be construed accordingly; (L.N. 37 of 2004)
United Kingdom Patent Office (聯合王國專利局) means the office established under the laws of the United Kingdom for the granting of patents for inventions.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reference to the filing of a document or other thing with the Registrar, or reference to the filing of a document or other thing without an indication of the place at which or person with whom it is to be filed, shall be construed as a reference to the filing of the document or thing with the Registrar in accordance with sections 93, 93A, 93B and 93C of these Rules; (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reference to a document in any proceedings before the Registrar being in the specified form is to be construed as a reference to the document being in such form, if any, as may be specified by the Registrar under section 150 of the Ordinance in connection with those proceedings.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Specified forms
section.leadIn: A requirement to use a specified form is satisfied by the use of either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a replica of the specified form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a form acceptable to the Registrar,

section.continued: that contains the information required by the specified form and complies with any directions of the Registrar as to the use of the specified form or replicas of it.

section.name: s2B
section.heading: Request

subsection.leadIn: A person (requester) may make a request to the Registrar in relation to section 9F(1) or (2) of the Ordinance (request) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a request to make a finding in relation to section 9F(1) of the Ordinance—the requester has a right to be mentioned as the inventor or a joint inventor of an invention in—

subparagraph.content: any published patent application for the invention; or
any patent granted for the invention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a request to make a finding in relation to section 9F(2) of the Ordinance—a person ought not to have been mentioned as the sole inventor or a joint inventor of an invention in—

subparagraph.content: any published patent application for the invention; or
any patent granted for the invention.

subsection.leadIn: The request must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the facts on which the requester relies; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the finding sought; and
the prescribed fee for the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: A requester who files a request must, at the same time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the request and statement to each person who meets the conditions specified in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to each copy of the request and statement a list of the names and addresses of all those persons; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: notify the Registrar in writing of those names and addresses.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not the requester; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person falls within any of the following descriptions—

subparagraph.content: the person is registered as a proprietor of the patent;
the person is an applicant for the patent;
the person has been identified in the patent application or the patent as the inventor or a joint inventor of the invention;
the person has been identified in the statement as the inventor or a joint inventor of the invention;
the person is shown in the register as having a right in or under the patent application or the patent.

section.name: s2C
section.heading: Counter-statement

subsection.content: A person who receives a copy of a request and statement under section 2B(3)(a) of these Rules and intends to oppose the request (opponent) may file a counter-statement with the Registrar.
The counter-statement must be filed within 3 months after the date on which the copy of the request and statement is received by the opponent.

subsection.leadIn: The counter-statement must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of opposition; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the counter-statement.

subsection.leadIn: An opponent who files a counter-statement must, at the same time, send a copy of it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person making the request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other persons to whom a copy of the request and statement is sent.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

section.name: s2D
section.heading: Exhibition and meeting under section 11A of Ordinance
section.leadIn: The following exhibitions and meeting are prescribed for the purposes of section 11A(2)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an international exhibition sponsored or recognized by the Central People’s Government;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an academic or technological meeting organized by—

subparagraph.content: a competent agency of the Central People’s Government; or
a national academic or technological association recognized by the Central People’s Government.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Who may Apply for Standard Patent (R)

section.name: s3
section.heading: References to Registrar under section 13(1)(a) or (b) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A reference to the Registrar under section 13(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a statement setting out fully the nature of the question, the facts upon which the person making the reference relies and the order or relief sought; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a reference under section 13(1)(a) of the Ordinance, the person making the reference shall, at the same time as he files it, send a copy of the reference and statement to each of the following persons (not being a party to the reference)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each person who is alleged in the reference to be entitled to apply for the grant of a standard patent (R) for the invention that is the subject of the reference;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each person whom the person making the reference believes to be the inventor or joint inventor of that invention; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if an application for a standard patent (R) for that invention has been published before the reference is filed, each person who is shown in the register as having a right in or under that application. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a reference under section 13(1)(b) of the Ordinance, the person making the reference shall, at the same time as he files it, send a copy of the reference and statement—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: to each of the following persons (not being a party to the reference)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: each person to whom it is alleged in the reference any right in or under the application should be transferred or granted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each person whom the person making the reference believes to be the inventor or joint inventor of the invention that is the subject of the reference; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if an application for a standard patent (R) for that invention has been published before the reference is filed, to each person who is not a party to the reference and is shown in the register as having a right in or under that application.

subsection.content: The person making the reference shall attach to each copy of the reference and statement he sends under subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be, a notice containing the names and addresses of all persons to whom a copy of the reference and statement is being sent under that subsection, and he shall notify the Registrar in writing of the names and addresses of those persons.

subsection.leadIn: In addition, if an application for a standard patent (R) for the invention that is the subject of a reference under section 13(1)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance has been filed but the application has not been published before the reference is filed, the Registrar shall send a copy of the reference and statement to each of the following persons (not being a party to the reference or a person to whom copies have been sent under subsection (2) or (3), as the case may be)— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each person who is an applicant for the standard patent (R); and (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each person who has a right in or under the patent application as shown in an application to register, or a notice, that is mentioned in section 46(1) of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall send a notice containing the names and addresses of all persons to whom copies of the reference and statement have been sent under subsection (5) to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each person to whom copies have been sent under that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person making the reference; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each person whose name and address has been notified to the Registrar under subsection (4).

subsection.content: Any person who receives a copy of the reference and statement under subsection (2), (3) or (5) and who wishes to oppose the making of the order or the granting of the relief sought (the opponent) shall, within 3 months from the date on which the copies are received by the person, file a counter-statement which shall be in the specified form, shall set out fully the grounds of opposition and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The opponent shall, at the same time as he files the counter-statement, send a copy of it to each of the following persons (not being a party to the counter-statement)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person making the reference;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each person whose name and address has been notified to him under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each person whose name and address has been notified to him under subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (8)(a), (b) or (c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, within 3 months after the date on which the copy of the counter-statement is received by the person, file evidence in support of the case of the person making the reference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person files the evidence—must send a copy of it to—

subparagraph.content: the opponent; and
if the evidence is not filed by the person making the reference—the person making the reference. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: On filing evidence under subsection (9), a person referred to in subsection (8)(b) or (c) joins as a party to the reference. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Within 3 months from the date on which a copy of evidence is received by the opponent under subsection (9) or, if no evidence is filed under that subsection, within 3 months after the expiry of the time within which the evidence might have been filed, the opponent— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may file evidence in support of the opponent’s case; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the opponent files the evidence—must send a copy of it to—

subparagraph.content: the person making the reference; and
any other person who has filed the evidence under subsection (9).

subsection.leadIn:
The person making the reference and any other person to whom a copy of the opponent’s evidence is sent under subsection (10) may, within 3 months from the date on which the copy is
received by the person, file further evidence confined to matters strictly in reply to the opponent’s evidence and, if the person files the further evidence, the person must send a copy of it to— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the opponent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if further evidence is filed by that other person—the person making the reference.

subsection.content: No further evidence shall be filed except by leave or direction of the Registrar.

The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the reference, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Orders under section 13 of Ordinance

subsection.content: Where an order is made as is mentioned in section 14(2) of the Ordinance, the Registrar shall notify all original applicants and their licensees of whom he is aware of the making of the order.

subsection.leadIn: A request under section 14(3) of the Ordinance shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a request by the original applicant or any of the original applicants, within 2 months from the date of the notification under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a request by a licensee, within 4 months from the date of the notification under subsection (1). (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Authorization under section 13(5) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (5) of section 13 of the Ordinance for authority to do anything on behalf of a person to whom directions have been given under subsection (3)(c) or (4) of that section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a statement setting out fully the facts upon which the applicant relies and the nature of the authorization sought; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The applicant shall, at the same time as he files the application, send a copy of the application and statement to the person alleged to have failed to comply with the directions.
The Registrar may give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Reference to the Registrar under section 14(5) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Where, following the making of an order as is mentioned in subsection (2) of section 14 of the Ordinance, a question is referred to the Registrar under subsection (5) of that section as to whether any person is entitled to be granted a licence or whether the period or terms of a licence are reasonable, the reference shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a statement setting out fully the facts upon which the person making the reference relies and the period and terms of the licence which he is prepared to accept or grant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The person making the reference shall, at the same time as he files the reference, send a copy of the reference and statement to every person in whose name the application is to proceed or, as the case may be, every person claiming to be entitled to be granted a licence, in either case not being a person who makes the reference.

If any recipient of the reference and statement does not agree to grant or accept the licence for such period and upon such terms as are set out in the statement, the recipient must, within 3 months from the date on which the copies are received by the recipient, file a counter-statement setting out fully the grounds of the recipient’s objection. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The counter-statement shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The recipient shall, at the same time as he files the counter-statement, send a copy of it to the person making the reference.

subsection.content: The Registrar may give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

division.name: D2
division.heading: Request to Record Designated Patent Application

section.name: s8
section.heading: Request to record a designated patent application under section 15 of Ordinance

subsection.content: A request to record a designated patent application under section 15 of the Ordinance (or, in the case of a designated patent application that is the national phase of an international application under the Patent Cooperation Treaty, under that section as applied by section 16 of the Ordinance) shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: Further to section 15(2) of the Ordinance (including that section as applied by section 16 of the Ordinance)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the documents required under paragraph (a) of that subsection—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: shall be exempted from any requirement under section 104(1) of the Ordinance to be filed in one of the official languages;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents prescribed for the purposes of paragraph (d) of that subsection are those mentioned in section 9 of these Rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars shall be set out in the request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of filing of the designated patent application;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the title of the invention;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the application number of the designated patent application;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the publication number (if any) assigned to the designated patent application by the designated patent office, and the date (if any) of its publication by the designated patent office; (L.N. 48 of 2002)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the designated patent application is the national phase of an international application, the following particulars shall be set out on the request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application number of the international application;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the filing date of the international application;

subparagraph.name: iii
A
subparagraph.content: if the designated patent application is based on the international application referred to in section 15(1)(a)(i), (ii) or (iii) of these Rules, as the case requires—the date of publication of the international application by the designated patent office showing that the international application has entered the national phase in the designated patent office; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the date of issuance of an official notification referred to in section 15(1)(b) of these Rules, if applicable; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a request to record a divisional designated patent application as provided for in section 22 of the Ordinance or a request to record in a new application made pursuant to an order under section 55(4) of the Ordinance, the following particulars in relation to the earlier application for a standard patent (R) shall be set out in the request to record— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the application number of the earlier application;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the filing date of the earlier application;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date of publication of the request to record of the earlier application;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the request shall contain a list of the documents comprising the request to record and an indication of the number of sheets of each such document.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Documents supporting statement of derivation of entitlement to apply
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 15(2)(d) of the Ordinance, the following documents are prescribed in relation to an applicant’s statement explaining his entitlement to apply for the grant of a patent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the statement under that section indicates that the applicant for a standard patent (R) is the successor in title to the person named in the designated patent application as applicant— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: copies of such documents as establish the transfer, assignment or mortgage of the rights under the designated patent application in Hong Kong from that person to the applicant for a standard patent (R); or (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the absence of any such document in relation to a particular transfer, assignment or mortgage, a statement signed by the transferor, assignor or mortgagor confirming the fact of the transfer or assignment or mortgage;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the statement indicates that the applicant for a standard patent (R), not being a person specified in paragraph (a), is the inventor of the invention who is entitled to the property in the invention in Hong Kong, such documents as establish that entitlement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the statement indicates that the applicant for a standard patent (R) is the successor in title to the person specified in paragraph (b), the documents specified in that paragraph and, in addition— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: such documents as evidence the transfer or assignment or mortgage (whether by a single such transaction or by a number of such transactions) of the property in the invention in Hong Kong from the inventor of the invention to the applicant;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the absence of any such document in relation to a particular transfer, assignment or mortgage, a statement signed by the transferor, assignor or mortgagor confirming the fact of the transfer, assignment or mortgage.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Details relating to the previous disclosure of the invention
section.leadIn: For the purposes of the statement required under section 15(2)(f) of the Ordinance, the following details relating to the previous disclosure of the invention are prescribed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and place of the exhibition or meeting referred to in section 2D of these Rules at which the invention was first disclosed; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the opening date of such exhibition or meeting;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the first disclosure of the invention did not take place on the opening date of such exhibition or meeting, the date of such first disclosure.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Grace period
section.leadIn: If a filing fee or an advertisement fee payable under section 15(4) of the Ordinance is not paid within the time limit specified in that section, it is to be regarded as having been paid within the time limit if it is paid, with an additional fee, within a grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is allowed by the Registrar by a notice given to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: begins on the date of expiry of the time limit; and
ends at the expiry of 1 month after the date of the notice.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Size and presentation of documents

subsection.content: This section applies to the documents comprising a request to record to be filed under section 15(2) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must be presented in a manner that it may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reproduced in an unlimited number of copies by photography, photocopying processes, photo offset and microfilming; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: scanned by a device capable of capturing an image of the document and converting the image into a form suitable for storage on, and retrieval by, a computer.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be free from cracks, creases and folds;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be single-sided;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be on A4 papers (29.7 cm × 21 cm) that are pliable, strong, white, smooth, matt and durable;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not share a sheet with another document; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the document has more than one sheet, comprise sheets that are—

subparagraph.content: connected in a way that the sheets can easily be turned over, separated and combined again; and
numbered in consecutive Arabic numerals.

subsection.leadIn: All documents must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: legible; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonably free from deletions and other alterations, overwritings and interlineations.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may exempt a document from any requirement under this section if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authenticity of the content of the document is not in question and the requirements for good reproduction are not in jeopardy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar considers that there are other circumstances that justify the exemption.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Form of statements, counter-statements and evidence
section.content: Subject to the Registrar’s direction, any statement, counter-statement or evidence to be filed with the Registrar must comply with the requirements under section 12(2) and (3)(c) of these Rules as if those requirements applied to the statement, counter-statement or evidence.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Issue of receipt by Registrar
section.leadIn: On first receipt of any of the documents comprising a request to record the Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark the documents with the date of their receipt by him and assign a number to the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant a receipt which shows the number so assigned, the nature and number of the documents received and the date of their receipt.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Date of publication of designated patent application based on international application under section 16 of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 15(1) of the Ordinance, and despite section 5(2)(d)(ii) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the reference to the date of publication of the designated patent application based on an international application under section 16(a)(i) of the Ordinance is to be construed as—

subparagraph.content: for an international application designating the European Patent Office—the date of publication by the European Patent Office in its Bulletin of the relevant bibliographical data showing that the international application has entered the national phase in the European Patent Office;

for an international application designating the United Kingdom Patent Office—the date of publication by the United Kingdom Patent Office in its Official Journal (Patents) of the relevant bibliographical data showing that the international application has entered the national phase in the United Kingdom Patent Office; or

for an international application designating the China National Intellectual Property Administration—the date of publication by the China National Intellectual Property Administration in its Patent Gazette of the relevant bibliographical data showing that the international application has entered the national phase in the China National Intellectual Property Administration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to the other date referred to in section 16(a)(ii) of the Ordinance as applicable to an international application designating the China National Intellectual Property Administration published by the International Bureau in the Chinese language is to be construed as the date of issuance of an official notification by the China National Intellectual Property Administration stating that the international application has entered the national phase in the China National Intellectual Property Administration.

subsection.content: An application to which section 16(a)(ii) of the Ordinance applies must be accompanied by a copy of the official notification issued by the China National Intellectual Property Administration.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Notice following examination under section 18 of Ordinance

subsection.content: If a request to record does not comply with any of the requirements under section 17(1) of the Ordinance, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant that unless the applicant corrects the deficiencies within 1 month after the date of the notice, the request is not to be dealt with as a standard patent (R) application.
If the applicant corrects the deficiencies within the time limit, the Registrar must inform the applicant of the date of filing accorded to the request to record.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Correction of deficiencies in request to record
section.content: If an examination of a request to record under section 19(1) of the Ordinance reveals deficiencies in the request that may be corrected, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to correct the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Request to record divisional designated patent application under section 22 of Ordinance

subsection.content: A request to record a divisional designated patent application (new request to record) under section 22(1) of the Ordinance shall, except as mentioned below, be filed in accordance with section 15(2) of the Ordinance.

The relevant provisions of the Ordinance or these Rules concerning the filing date and compliance with the formalities shall be considered on the basis of the actual date of filing of the new request to record and not on the basis of the date of filing of the earlier request to record.

The provisions of sections 8 to 17 of these Rules shall apply as if references in those sections to a designated patent application are references to a divisional designated patent application. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

Where possible, the description and drawings of the earlier request to record and the new request to record shall respectively relate only to the matter for which protection is sought by that request to record; however where it is necessary for a request to record to describe the matter for which protection is sought by reference to another request to record, such reference shall include the application number assigned to that other request to record and shall indicate the matter for which protection is claimed in the other request to record.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Request for registration of designated patent and grant of patent under section 23(1) of Ordinance

subsection.content: A request to register a designated patent and grant a patent for the invention shown in the specification of the designated patent under section 23(1) of the Ordinance must be in the specified form. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: Further to section 23(3) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the document required under section 23(3)(a) of the Ordinance shall be filed in accordance with section 12 of these Rules; (L.N. 37 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents prescribed for the purposes of section 23(3)(b) of the Ordinance are those mentioned in section 20 of these Rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the request shall also state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the publication number, application number and date of publication of the request to record;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the title of the invention;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date of grant and publication number of the designated patent;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: the request shall contain a list of the documents comprising the request to register and an indication of the number of sheets of each such document.

subsection.content: The provisions of section 12 of these Rules apply in relation to a request to register a designated patent and the grant of a patent under this section as they apply in relation to a request to record a designated patent application.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Documents supporting statement of derivation of entitlement to apply
section.content: For the purposes of section 23(3)(b) of the Ordinance, the documents to be filed in support of an applicant’s statement explaining his entitlement to apply for the grant of a patent are such documents as suffice to establish that entitlement as set out in the statement.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Grace period
section.leadIn: If a filing fee or an advertisement fee payable under section 23(5) of the Ordinance is not paid within the time limit specified in that section, it is to be regarded as having been paid within the time limit if it is paid, with an additional fee, within a grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is allowed by the Registrar by a notice given to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: begins on the date of expiry of the time limit; and
ends at the expiry of 1 month after the date of the notice.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Issue of receipt by Registrar
section.leadIn: On first receipt of any of the documents comprising a request for registration and grant, the Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark the documents with the date of their receipt by him; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant a receipt which shows the application number assigned to the matter under section 14(b) of these Rules, the nature and number of the documents received and the date of receipt. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Communication following examination under section 25(1) of Ordinance

subsection.content: If a request for registration and grant fails to meet any of the requirements laid down in section 24(1) of the Ordinance, the Registrar shall communicate the disclosed deficiencies to the applicant and inform him of the consequences provided under section 25(4) of the Ordinance in the event of a failure to remedy those deficiencies within 1 month of the date of the communication. (L.N. 35 of 2019)
If the applicant remedies the disclosed deficiencies within that period, he shall be informed of the date of filing accorded to the request for registration and grant.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Correction of deficiencies in request for registration and grant
section.content: If an examination of a request for registration and grant under section 26(1) of the Ordinance reveals deficiencies in the request that may be corrected, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to correct the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Notice requesting reinstatement of an application under section 28 of Ordinance
section.content: A notice under section 28 of the Ordinance requesting reinstatement of an application for a standard patent (R) shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the additional prescribed fee.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Application for restoration of rights under section 29 of Ordinance
section.content: An application under section 29 of the Ordinance for restoration of rights lost in relation to an application for a standard patent (R) shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the additional prescribed fee.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Provisions on Standard Patent (R) Applications before Grant

section.name: s27
section.heading: Amendment of application for standard patent (R) under section 31 of Ordinance

subsection.content: Any amendment under section 31 of the Ordinance to an application for a standard patent (R) shall be made by way of application to the Registrar in the specified form. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: An application for amendment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall clearly identify the proposed amendment and state the reasons for it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of amendment to which section 31(2) of the Ordinance applies, shall be accompanied by a verified copy of the amendment made to the corresponding designated patent application and, where appropriate, a prescribed translation of that amendment.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Maintenance of application for standard patent (R) under section 33 of Ordinance

subsection.content: An application to maintain an application for a standard patent (R) under section 33 of the Ordinance shall be in the specified form. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

Where the period specified in section 33(2) of the Ordinance for the making of a maintenance application in respect of a standard patent (R) application has expired, the Registrar shall, not later than 6 weeks after the last date for making the maintenance application under that subsection and if the maintenance fee specified in that subsection remains unpaid, send to the applicant of the standard patent (R) application a notice informing him that the period for making a maintenance application has expired and of the consequences of not making such an application and paying the fees specified in section 33(4) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Notice under subsection (2) shall be directed to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address specified by the applicant of the maintenance application on payment of the last maintenance fee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where another address has been notified to him for that purpose by the applicant of the maintenance application since the last maintenance, that address,

subsection.continued: or, in any other case, the address for service entered in the register.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Correction of deficiencies and removal of doubts in maintenance documents

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notes deficiencies in a maintenance application under section 33(2) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has reason to doubt the veracity of any statement in the application. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.content: The Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant that unless the applicant corrects the deficiencies or removes the doubt, as the case requires, within 2 months after the date of the notice, the maintenance application is to be refused. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

If, upon consideration of the statements contained in a maintenance application, the Registrar is not satisfied that a case for maintenance under section 33 of the Ordinance has been made out, he shall notify the applicant accordingly and, unless within 1 month the applicant requests to be heard in the matter, the Registrar shall refuse the application.

If the applicant requests a hearing within the time allowed, the Registrar shall, after giving the applicant an opportunity of being heard, determine whether the maintenance application shall be allowed or refused.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Notification of deemed withdrawn application for standard patent (R)
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a standard patent (R) has been deemed to be withdrawn and abandoned because a maintenance fee has not been paid within the period specified in section 33(2) and (3) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extended period specified in section 33(4) of the Ordinance has expired without the maintenance fee and prescribed additional fee having been paid,

section.continued: the Registrar shall, within 6 weeks after the expiration of the extended period, notify the applicant of the standard patent (R) of the fact and draw his attention to the provisions of section 34 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Restoration of application for standard patent (R) under section 34 of Ordinance

subsection.content: An application to restore an application for a standard patent (R) under section 34 of the Ordinance must be in the specified form. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The restoration application shall contain statements by the applicant in relation to matters relevant to the restoration of the application for a standard patent (R) indicating whether at the date of the restoration application— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designated patent application is still valid or has been withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a patent has been granted in pursuance of that designated patent application and, if granted, the time for filing a request to register the designated patent and grant a patent under section 23 of the Ordinance has expired.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The applicant must file evidence with the Registrar to satisfy, for the purposes of section 34(3)(a) of the Ordinance, the Registrar that the applicant has taken all reasonable care required by the circumstances of the case. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: If the application is not accompanied by the evidence required by subsection (2A), the Registrar must specify a period within which the evidence must be filed with the Registrar. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

If, upon consideration of the statements and the evidence (if any), the Registrar is not satisfied that a case for an order under section 34 of the Ordinance has been made out, he shall notify the applicant accordingly and, unless within 1 month the applicant requests to be heard in the matter, the Registrar shall refuse the application. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

If the applicant requests a hearing within the time allowed, the Registrar shall, after giving the applicant an opportunity of being heard, determine whether the application shall be allowed or refused.

If the Registrar decides to allow the application, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to file an application specified for the purposes of section 33(2) of the Ordinance within 2 months after the date of the notice. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by any unpaid maintenance fee and any additional fee prescribed for the purposes of section 33(4) of the Ordinance. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: On receiving the application, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the restoration of the standard patent (R) application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the order by notice in the official journal. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Non-prejudicial disclosure under section 37B of Ordinance
section.leadIn: The following constitute the written evidence prescribed for the purposes of section 37B(2)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate, issued by the authority responsible for holding the international exhibition referred to in that section, stating—

subparagraph.content: that the invention was displayed at the exhibition; and
the date of the first disclosure of the invention at the exhibition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an identification of the invention duly authenticated by the authority.

section.name: s31B
section.heading: Restoration of priority right under section 37D of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies to a restoration application under section 37D of the Ordinance in relation to the priority right of a subsequent standard patent (O) application referred to in section 37D(1)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A restoration application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: a statement of priority referred to in section 37E(1) of the Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to establish why the subsequent standard patent (O) application was not filed before the expiry of the period of 12 months referred to in section 37C(2) of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to satisfy the Registrar that all reasonable care required by the circumstances of the case has been taken for the purposes of section 37D(5) of the Ordinance; and
the prescribed fee for the restoration application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.content: If the restoration application is not accompanied by the evidence required by subsection (2)(b)(ii), the Registrar must specify a period within which the evidence must be filed with the Registrar.
If there is any deficiency in the statement of priority filed, the Registrar must specify a period within which the deficiency must be corrected.

subsection.leadIn: The restoration application is to be regarded as being withdrawn if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the evidence is not filed within the period specified under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deficiency is not corrected within the period specified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar approves the restoration application, the following documents must be filed with the Registrar within a period specified by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the patent application on the basis of which the priority right is restored (previous application); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of the certificate (certificate) that—

subparagraph.content: is issued by the authority that received the previous application; and
states the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.content: If the previous application is a Hong Kong application as defined by section 37A of the Ordinance, the copy of the previous application and the copy of the certificate are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: If the previous application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 56(1) and 56A of these Rules apply to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may make a requirement under section 56B(5) of these Rules in relation to it.

subsection.content: If a copy of the previous application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(5) of these Rules as applied by subsection (8) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

section.name: s31C
section.heading: Claiming priority under section 37E of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 31D of these Rules, this section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant of a standard patent (O) application (subsequent application) claims priority of a non-Hong Kong application or Hong Kong application (previous application) under section 37E of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the subsequent application is within 12 months after the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must file with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of priority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents referred to in subsection (7).

subsection.content: A statement of priority must be filed with the Registrar in the specified form together with the subsequent application.
Despite subsection (3), if the conditions specified in subsection (5) are met, the statement of priority may be filed within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statement of priority is accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either one of the following—

subparagraph.content: the applicant has not made a request under section 37Q(2) of the Ordinance for publication of the subsequent application;
if the applicant has made the request—the request is withdrawn before preparations for publication of the subsequent application are completed.

subsection.leadIn: The statement of priority must state the following particulars of the previous application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of filing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the country, territory or area in or for which the previous application was made.

subsection.leadIn: The following documents must be filed with the Registrar within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the previous application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of the certificate (certificate) that—

subparagraph.content: is issued by the authority that received the previous application; and
states the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.content: If the previous application is a Hong Kong application, the copy of the previous application and the copy of the certificate are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: If the previous application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 56(1) and 56A of these Rules apply to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may make a requirement under section 56B(5) of these Rules in relation to it.

subsection.content: If a copy of the previous application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(5) of these Rules as applied by subsection (9) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Hong Kong application (香港申請) has the meaning given by section 37A of the Ordinance;
non-Hong Kong application (非香港申請) has the meaning given by section 37A of the Ordinance.

section.name: s31D
section.heading: Claiming priority for divisional standard patent (O) application

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an earlier standard patent (O) application referred to in section 37Z(1)(a) of the Ordinance has been filed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant or the applicant’s successor in title files a new application referred to in section 37Z(1)(b) of the Ordinance that meets the conditions specified in section 37Z(3) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: A right of priority that has not been claimed for the earlier standard patent (O) application may not be claimed for the new application.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Reference to Registrar on Question as to who may Apply

section.name: s31E
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
section.def: additional recipient (額外收件人)—see section 31F(4)(a) of these Rules;
counter-statement (反陳述)—see section 31G(1) of these Rules;
opponent (反對人)—see section 31G(1) of these Rules;
recipient (收件人)—see section 31F(2)(a) of these Rules;
referrer (轉介人) means a person who makes a reference;
statement (陳述書)—see section 31F(1)(b)(i) of these Rules.

section.name: s31F
section.heading: Reference

subsection.leadIn: A reference must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the nature of the question being referred;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the facts on which the referrer relies; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the order or relief sought; and
the prescribed fee for the reference; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: A referrer who files a reference must, at the same time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the reference and statement to each person who meets the conditions specified in subsection (3) (recipient);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach to each copy of the reference and statement a list of the names and addresses of all recipients; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: notify the Registrar in writing of those names and addresses.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not a party to the reference;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a reference under section 37H(1)(a) of the Ordinance, the person is—

subparagraph.content: believed by the referrer to be the inventor or a joint inventor of the invention;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a reference under section 37H(1)(b) of the Ordinance, the person is—

subparagraph.content: a joint proprietor of the application who has not otherwise indicated the joint proprietor’s consent to the making of the order, or the granting of the relief, sought in the reference; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to whom it is alleged in the reference that any right in or under the application should be transferred or granted; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: whom the referrer believes to be the inventor or a joint inventor of the invention; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a reference filed after the application has been published, the person is shown in the register as having a right in or under the application.

subsection.leadIn: If the reference is filed before the standard patent (O) application has been published, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: send a list of the names and addresses of all recipients and additional recipients to—

subparagraph.content: the referrer;
each recipient; and
each additional recipient.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not a party to the reference;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not a recipient; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: is an applicant of the standard patent (O) application; or

has a right in or under the application as shown in an application to register, or a notice of, a transaction, instrument or event in relation to the application referred to in section 46(1) of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s31G
section.heading: Counter-statement

subsection.content: A recipient or an additional recipient who receives a copy of a reference and statement under section 31F(2) or (4) of these Rules and intends to oppose the making of the order, or granting of the relief, sought in the reference (opponent) may file a counter-statement with the Registrar.
The counter-statement must be filed within 3 months after the date on which the copy of the reference is received by the opponent.

subsection.leadIn: The counter-statement must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of opposition; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the counter-statement.

subsection.leadIn: An opponent who files a counter-statement must, at the same time, send a copy of it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the referrer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the recipient—

subparagraph.content: who is not the opponent; and
whose name and address appear in the list mentioned in section 31F(2)(b) or (4)(b) of these Rules; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the additional recipient—

subparagraph.content: who is not the opponent; and
whose name and address appear in the list mentioned in section 31F(4)(b) of these Rules.

section.name: s31H
section.heading: Evidence

subsection.content: A person referred to in section 31G(4)(a), (b) or (c) of these Rules may file evidence in support of the referrer’s case.
On filing evidence under subsection (1), a person referred to in section 31G(4)(b) or (c) of these Rules joins as a party to the reference.
The evidence must be filed with the Registrar within 3 months after the date on which the last copy of the counter-statement is received by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who files evidence under subsection (1) must, at the same time, send a copy of it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the opponent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is not the referrer—the referrer.

subsection.content: The opponent may file evidence in support of the opponent’s case.

subsection.leadIn: The opponent’s evidence must be filed with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a copy of evidence has been sent under subsection (4)(a)—within 3 months after the date on which the last copy of the evidence is received by the opponent under that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no copy of evidence has been sent under subsection (4)(a)—within 3 months after the time when a copy of evidence is required to be sent under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: An opponent who files evidence under subsection (5) must, at the same time, send a copy of it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the referrer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who has filed evidence under subsection (1).

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (10), the referrer and the other person may file further evidence in reply to the opponent’s evidence filed under subsection (5) within 3 months after the date on which the last copy of the opponent’s evidence is received by the referrer and the other person under subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: A person who files further evidence under subsection (8) must, at the same time, send a copy of it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the opponent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is not the referrer—the referrer.

subsection.content: No further evidence may be filed except with the leave granted by, or at the direction of, the Registrar.

The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the reference, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Application to Registrar in relation to Directions Given by Registrar or Court

section.name: s31I
section.heading: Application to Registrar under section 37I(4) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies to an application made by person B under section 37I(4) of the Ordinance in relation to the directions given to person A under section 37I(1)(d)(ii) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the facts on which the applicant relies; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the nature of the authorization sought; and
the prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.content: Person B must, when the application is filed, send a copy of the application and statement to person A.

The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: person A (後者) has the meaning given by section 37I(4) of the Ordinance;
person B (前者) has the meaning given by section 37I(4) of the Ordinance.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: New Standard Patent (O) Application under Section 37J(2) of Ordinance and Existing Standard Patent (O) Application Referred to in Section 37K(2) of Ordinance

section.name: s31J
section.heading: Registrar’s notice to applicant and licensee of order under section 37J(2) of Ordinance or referred to in section 37K(2) of Ordinance and request for licence under section 37K(5)(b) of Ordinance

subsection.content: If a specified order is made in relation to a standard patent (O) application, the Registrar must, by notice given to each of the persons specified in subsection (2), notify the persons of the order.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant of the earlier application referred to in section 37J(1)(a) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the original applicant referred to in section 37K(2) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensee of the applicant referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) whom the Registrar is aware of when the notice is given.

subsection.leadIn: A request for licence under section 37K(5)(b) of the Ordinance may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the applicant of the earlier application within 2 months after the date of the notice given to the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the original applicant within 2 months after the date of the notice given to the original applicant; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the licensee within 4 months after the date of the notice given to the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order made under section 37J(2) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order referred to in section 37K(2) of the Ordinance.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Reference to Registrar in relation to Licence to Continue Working or to Work on Invention

section.name: s31K
section.heading: Reference

subsection.leadIn: A person (referrer) may make a reference to the Registrar under section 37K(7) of the Ordinance in relation to a licence (reference) after the making of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under section 37J(2) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order referred to in section 37K(2) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A licence for the purposes of subsection (1) is a licence under section 37K(3) or (4) of the Ordinance to continue working or to work, as the case requires, the invention that is the subject of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a new standard patent (O) application made in accordance with the order referred to in subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a standard patent (O) application that is to proceed in accordance with the order referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A reference must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the facts on which the referrer relies; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the period and terms of the licence that the referrer is prepared to grant or accept; and
the prescribed fee for the reference; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.content: A referrer who files a reference must, at the same time, send a copy of the reference and statement to each person who meets the conditions specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not the referrer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: is the one in whose name the new standard patent (O) application is made or the standard patent (O) application is to proceed; or
claims to be entitled to be granted a licence.

section.name: s31L
section.heading: Counter-statement

subsection.content: A person who receives a copy of a reference under section 31K(4) of these Rules and does not agree to grant or accept the licence for the period or on the terms set out in the statement (opponent) may file a counter-statement with the Registrar.
The counter-statement must be filed within 3 months after the date on which the copy of the reference is received by the opponent.

subsection.leadIn: The counter-statement must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of disagreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the counter-statement.

subsection.content: An opponent who files a counter-statement must, at the same time, send a copy of it to the referrer referred to in section 31K(1) of these Rules.

The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the reference, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

section.name: s31M
section.heading: Standard patent (O) application under section 37L of Ordinance

subsection.content: A standard patent (O) application under section 37L of the Ordinance must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The specification referred to in section 37L(2)(b) of the Ordinance must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the title of the invention that is the subject of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: include—

subparagraph.content: a description of the invention;
at least one claim; and
drawings referred to in the description or the claim or claims, if any.

subsection.content: The title of the invention must be short and indicate the matter to which the invention relates.

subsection.leadIn: A standard patent (O) application under section 37L of the Ordinance must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the inventor or inventors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a list of the documents comprising the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an indication of the number of sheets of each of the documents;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of a claim regarding a disclosure that was due to, or in consequence of, the condition referred to in section 37B(2)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: a statement referred to in section 37B(3)(a) of the Ordinance; and
the prescribed written evidence referred to in section 31A of these Rules in support of the statement;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for the purposes of a claim for priority of a previous application under section 37E of the Ordinance—the documents required under section 31C(2) of these Rules and the documents required by application of section 31C(9) of these Rules, as the case requires; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for the purposes of a reference to an earlier specified application referred to in section 37M(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance—the documents required under section 31W(3) of these Rules and the documents required by application of section 31W(5) of these Rules, as the case requires; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: in the case of a new application for a patent made in compliance with an order under section 55(4) of the Ordinance—the number of the patent that has been conditionally or unconditionally revoked by the court. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: For section 37L(5) and (6) of the Ordinance, the filing fee and advertisement fee must be paid to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no later than 1 month after the date of receipt referred to in section 31U(c)(iii) of these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the fee is not paid within the time limit specified in paragraph (a)—with an additional fee within a grace period—

subparagraph.content: that is allowed by the Registrar by a notice given to the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: begins on the date of expiry of the time limit; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ends at the expiry of 1 month after the date of the notice.

section.name: s31N
section.heading: Description

subsection.content: This section applies to a description referred to in section 37L(2)(b)(i) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (O) application.

subsection.leadIn: The description— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the technical field to which the invention relates; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must indicate the background art that, as far as known to the applicant, can be regarded as useful for understanding the invention and may cite the documents reflecting the background art; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: must disclose the invention in a way that the following can be understood— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: the technical problem to which the invention relates (even if not so expressly stated); and
the solution to the problem;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: must state any advantageous effects of the invention with reference to the background art; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: must briefly describe the figures in the drawings, if any, referred to in—

subparagraph.content: the description; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: must describe in detail at least one way of carrying out the invention, using examples where appropriate and referring to the drawings, if any; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: must indicate the way in which the invention is industrially applicable, if it is not obvious from the description or nature of the invention. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.content: The description must be presented in the manner and order specified in subsection (2) unless not doing so is conducive to a better understanding of the invention because of its nature and a more economical presentation.

section.name: s31O
section.heading: Drawings referred to in description or claim

subsection.content: This section applies to the drawings referred to in the description or the claim or claims under section 37L(2)(b)(iii) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (O) application.

subsection.leadIn: The drawings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be on sheets each of which—

subparagraph.content: does not contain frames round the usable or used surface; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from the top—2.5 cm;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: from the left—2.5 cm;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: from the right—1.5 cm; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: from the bottom—1 cm; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be executed in the following manner—

subparagraph.content: the scale and distinctness of graphical execution must enable all details of the drawings to be distinguished without difficulty in a photographic reproduction of the drawings with a linear reduction in size to two-thirds of the drawings;
if, as an exception, a scale is given, the scale must be represented graphically;
all numbers, letters and reference signs must be simple and clear;
brackets, circles and inverted commas must not be used in association with numbers, letters and characters;
all lines must ordinarily be drawn with the aid of drafting instruments;
the height of the numbers, letters and characters must not be less than 0.32 cm;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Latin alphabets; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if customary—Greek alphabets or Chinese characters, as appropriate;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the same sheet of drawings contains several figures, the figures must be—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: arranged without wasting space and clearly separated from one another; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals, independently of the numbering of the sheets;

if the figures drawn on 2 or more sheets are intended to form one whole figure, the figures on the sheets must be so arranged that the whole figure can be assembled without concealing any part of the partial figures;
reference signs not mentioned in the description and claims must not appear;
reference signs not mentioned in the drawings must not appear in the description and claims;
the same features, when denoted by reference signs, must be denoted by the same signs throughout the application;

subparagraph.leadIn: the drawings must not contain any textual matter, except—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if required for a clear understanding of the drawings—the textual matter is a single word or words or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate; and

statutoryNote.heading: Example—
statutoryNote.content: Examples of the single word or words are “water”, “steam”, “open”, “close” and “section on AA”.

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: for electric circuits and block schematic or flow sheet diagrams, the textual matter is—

subparagraph.content: a few short catchwords or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate, that are required for a clear understanding of the drawings; and
placed in a way that it can, if required, be replaced by its translations without interfering with any lines; and
the sheets of the drawings must be numbered in accordance with section 31Q(3)(e)(ii) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: drawing (繪圖) includes a flow sheet and a diagram. Note— Section 31Q(13) of these Rules provides for exemption from this section.

section.name: s31P
section.heading: Abstract

subsection.content: This section applies to an abstract referred to in section 37L(2)(c) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (O) application.

subsection.leadIn: The abstract must—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain a concise summary of the matters contained in the specification referred to in section 37L(2)(b) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: normally, not contain more than 150 words or 200 Chinese characters, as appropriate;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: not contain statements on the alleged merits or value of the invention or on its speculative application.

subsection.leadIn: The summary referred to in subsection (2)(b) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the technical field to which the invention relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be written in a way that allows a clear understanding of—

subparagraph.content: the technical problem to which the invention relates;
the gist of the solution to the problem through the invention; and
the principal use or uses of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: If the specification provides for drawings—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the Registrar considers that any other figure or figures better characterize the invention—the Registrar may decide to publish the other figure or figures; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each main feature of the invention stated in the abstract and illustrated by a drawing must be followed by the reference sign relating to the feature used in that drawing, placed between parentheses.

section.name: s31Q
section.heading: Size and presentation of documents

subsection.content: This section applies to the documents comprising a standard patent (O) application to be filed under section 37L(1)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must be presented in a manner that it may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reproduced in an unlimited number of copies by photography, photocopying processes, photo offset and microfilming; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: scanned by a device capable of capturing an image of the document and converting the image into a form suitable for storage on, and retrieval by, a computer.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be free from cracks, creases and folds;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be single-sided;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be on A4 papers (29.7 cm × 21 cm) that are pliable, strong, white, smooth, matt and durable; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not share a sheet with another document; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the document has more than one sheet, comprise sheets that are—
