subparagraph.content: connected in a way that the sheets can easily be turned over, separated and combined again; and
numbered in consecutive Arabic numerals. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The description, claims and abstract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not contain drawings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain chemical or mathematical formulae;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (5)—may contain tables; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6)—must be typed or printed.

subsection.content: The claims may contain tables only if their subject matter makes the use of tables desirable.
If necessary, graphic symbols and chemical or mathematical formulae may be drawn or written by hand.
All textual matters in the description, claims and abstract must be in black and indelible.

subsection.leadIn: The tables and chemical or mathematical formulae—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b)—must be presented in an upright position on a sheet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if they cannot be presented satisfactorily in an upright position on a sheet—may be presented sideways on the sheet in a way that the top of the tables or formulae are at the left side of the sheet.

subsection.leadIn: In the documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: weights and measures must be expressed in metric units, whether or not they are also expressed in other units;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other physical values must be expressed in the units recognized in international practice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: chemical or mathematical formulae must be stated by employing the symbols, atomic weights and molecular formulae in general use; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: technical terms, signs and symbols generally accepted in the field in question must generally be used.

subsection.content: If a formula or symbol is used in the specification, a copy of the specification, prepared in the same manner as drawings, must be furnished if the Registrar so directs.
Terminology and signs must be consistent throughout the application.

subsection.leadIn: All documents must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: legible; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonably free from deletions and other alterations, overwritings and interlineations.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may exempt a document from any requirement under this section and section 31O of these Rules if— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authenticity of the content of the document is not in question and the requirements for good reproduction are not in jeopardy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar considers that there are other circumstances that justify the exemption.

section.name: s31R
section.heading: Form of statements, counter-statements and evidence
section.content: Subject to the Registrar’s direction, any statement, counter-statement or evidence to be filed with the Registrar must comply with the requirements under section 31Q(2) and (3)(c) of these Rules as if those requirements applied to the statement, counter-statement or evidence.

section.name: s31S
section.heading: Claims

subsection.content: This section applies to the claims referred to in section 37L(2)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (O) application.
The claims must define the matter for which protection is sought in terms of the technical features of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: If appropriate, an independent claim must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement indicating—

subparagraph.content: the designation of the subject matter of the invention; and
the technical features that are necessary for the definition of the claimed subject matter and, in combination, are part of the prior art; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a characterizing portion, preceded by the expression “characterized in that” or “characterized by” or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate, stating the technical features that, in combination with the technical features referred to in paragraph (a)(ii), the claim seeks to protect. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.content: An independent claim stating the essential features of an invention may be followed by one or more dependent claims concerning particular embodiments of the invention (dependent claim).

subsection.leadIn: A dependent claim that includes all the features of any other claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain a reference to that other claim, at the beginning if possible;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the additional features that the dependent claim seeks to protect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is admissible even if it directly refers to another claim that is also a dependent claim.

subsection.content: Dependent claims referring to a single or several previous claims must be grouped together according to the previous claims in the most appropriate way.
The number of the claims must, having regard to the nature of the invention claimed, be reasonable.
If there are 2 or more claims, the claims must be numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals.

subsection.leadIn: A claim must not rely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on references to the description or drawings in respect of the technical features of the invention unless it is absolutely necessary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in particular, on the following references or references similar to the following references—

subparagraph.content: “as described in part ... of the description”;
“as illustrated in figure ... of the drawings”;
“如說明第……部分所描述”; or
“如繪圖的附圖……所示”.

subsection.content: For an application that contains drawings, the technical features stated in the claims may be followed by the reference signs relating to the features used in the drawings, if doing so makes the claims easier to understand. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The reference signs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be placed between parentheses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not to be construed as limiting the claims.

section.name: s31T
section.heading: Statement under section 37L(3)(c) of Ordinance
section.content: The Registrar must send a copy of the statement referred to in section 37L(3)(c) of the Ordinance contained in a standard patent (O) application to each inventor of the relevant invention who is not an applicant.

section.name: s31U
section.heading: Registrar to issue receipt for documents
section.leadIn: On the first receipt of any of the documents comprising a standard patent (O) application, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark the date of receipt on the documents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assign an application number to the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: issue to the applicant a receipt that sets out—

subparagraph.content: the application number;
the nature and number of the documents; and
the date of receipt.

section.name: s31V
section.heading: Notice after examination of minimum requirement under section 37M of Ordinance

subsection.content: If a standard patent (O) application complies with the requirement specified in section 37M(3) of the Ordinance (minimum requirement), the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the earliest date on which the minimum requirement is complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If the application does not comply with the minimum requirement, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the deficiencies in the application as regards the non-compliance with the minimum requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that unless the applicant corrects the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice, the application is not to be dealt with as a standard patent (O) application.

subsection.content: If the applicant corrects the deficiencies within the period referred to in subsection (2)(b), the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the earliest date on which the minimum requirement is complied with.

section.name: s31W
section.heading: Requirements for making reference to earlier specified application referred to in section 37M(3)(c)(ii) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if a standard patent (O) application contains a purported reference to an earlier specified application referred to in section 37M(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) of the Ordinance, a reference to an earlier specified application is not to be regarded as having been made unless the reference states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the earlier specified application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application number of the earlier specified application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the country, territory or area in or for which the earlier specified application was made.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must file the following documents with the Registrar within 4 months after the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) of the Ordinance is complied with— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the earlier specified application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the certificate issued by the authority that received the earlier specified application (certificate).

subsection.content: If the earlier specified application is an application made under the Ordinance, the copies referred to in subsection (3)(a) and (b) are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.
If the earlier specified application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese, sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(3) of these Rules apply to it.

If a copy of the earlier specified application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(3) of these Rules as applied by subsection (5) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

section.name: s31X
section.heading: Filing for purposes of section 37N of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: If a missing description or missing drawing is required by a notice under section 37N(1) of the Ordinance to be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must be filed within 2 months after the date of the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the previous application documents must be filed for the purposes of section 37N(5)(d) of the Ordinance within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.leadIn: If a missing description or missing drawing is to be filed on an applicant’s own initiative under section 37N(2) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must be filed within 2 months after the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) of the Ordinance is complied with; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the previous application documents must be filed for the purposes of section 37N(5)(d) of the Ordinance within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.content: No notice is to be sent by the Registrar under section 37N(1) of the Ordinance after the Registrar is satisfied that the standard patent (O) application complies with the formal requirements under section 37P(1) of the Ordinance.

If the previous application referred to in section 37N(5)(a) of the Ordinance is an application made under the Ordinance, a copy of the previous application is to be regarded as having been filed in due time for the purposes of section 37N(5)(d) of the Ordinance.
If the previous application is in neither English nor Chinese, sections 56A and 56C of these Rules apply to it.

If a copy of the previous application or the translation required by sections 56A and 56C of these Rules as applied by subsection (5) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: missing description (欠交說明) has the meaning given by section 37N(6) of the Ordinance;
missing drawing (欠交繪圖) has the meaning given by section 37N(6) of the Ordinance;

previous application documents (過往申請的文件) means—(a)the copy of the previous application referred to in section 37N(5)(d)(i) of the Ordinance; and(b)the statement referred to in section 37N(5)(d)(iii) of the Ordinance indicating which part of the previous application represents the description or drawing that is missing in the standard patent (O) application.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Examination on Formal Requirements and Publication of Standard Patent (O) Application

section.name: s31Y
section.heading: Correction of deficiencies in standard patent (O) application as regards formal requirements

subsection.leadIn: If an examination under section 37P(1) of the Ordinance reveals deficiencies in a standard patent (O) application as regards the formal requirements within the meaning of that section, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the deficiencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the applicant to correct the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused or is to be regarded as being withdrawn under section 37P(2) or (4) of the Ordinance, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the refusal or withdrawal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the reasons for the refusal or withdrawal.

section.name: s31Z
section.heading: Time for publication of standard patent (O) application

subsection.leadIn: The prescribed time referred to in section 37Q(1)(a) of the Ordinance in relation to the publication of a standard patent (O) application is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is no claim for priority—18 months after the date of filing of the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is a claim for priority—18 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 37Q(1)(a) and (2) of the Ordinance, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the date on which preparations for publication are to be regarded as having been completed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the determination by notice given to the applicant as soon as practicable after determining the date.

section.name: s31ZA
section.heading: Observations by third parties

subsection.content: This section applies to a notice referred to in section 37R(1) of the Ordinance of a person’s observations on the patentability of an invention that is the subject of a standard patent (O) application.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must be filed with the Registrar during the following period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the date of publication of the application under section 37Q of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: before one of the following dates, as appropriate—

subparagraph.content: the date on which the Registrar gives notice of the Registrar’s determination under section 31ZP(2) of these Rules;
the date on which the Registrar gives a notice in relation to the standard patent (O) application under section 31ZI(5), 31ZK(4), 31ZM(4) or 31ZN(2) of these Rules; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

if the standard patent (O) application has not been subsequently reinstated or restored under section 37ZD of the Ordinance—the date on which the standard patent (O) application is withdrawn or is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: Section 37R(3) of the Ordinance does not apply to a notice that, in the opinion of the Registrar, would—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disparage any person in a way likely to damage the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be generally expected to encourage any offensive, immoral or anti-social behaviour.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Substantive Examination of Standard Patent (O) Applications and Grant of Standard Patents (O)

section.name: s31ZB
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: examination notice (審查通知)—see section 31ZD of these Rules;
examination requirement (審查規定) has the meaning given by section 37S of the Ordinance;
further examination notice (進一步審查通知)—see section 31ZF(2) of these Rules;
further review opinion (進一步覆核意見)—see section 31ZL(2) of these Rules;
provisional refusal notice (暫定拒絕通知)—see section 31ZH(2) of these Rules;
request to review (覆核請求)—see section 31ZI(1) of these Rules;
response to examination notice (審查通知的回應)—see section 31ZE(1) of these Rules;
response to review opinion (覆核意見的回應)—see section 31ZK(1) of these Rules;
review opinion (覆核意見)—see section 31ZJ of these Rules;
substantive examination (實質審查) means an examination under section 37U(2) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s31ZC
section.heading: Request for substantive examination

subsection.leadIn: A request made for substantive examination of a standard patent (O) application under section 37T(1) of the Ordinance must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The prescribed time referred to in section 37T(2)(a) of the Ordinance is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O) application that is not a specified new application—3 years after the material date of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a specified new application the fulfilment date of which is not less than 2 months before the expiry of the period of 3 years after the material date of the earlier application—3 years after the material date of the earlier application (3-year period);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a specified new application the fulfilment date of which is less than 2 months before the expiry of the 3-year period—2 months after the fulfilment date of the new application; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a specified new application the fulfilment date of which is on or after the date of expiry of the 3-year period—2 months after the fulfilment date of the new application.

subsection.content: The prescribed fee for the request must be paid to the Registrar no later than 1 month after the date of the request.

subsection.leadIn: If the prescribed fee is not paid within the time limit specified in subsection (3), it is to be regarded as having been paid within the time limit if it is paid within a grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is allowed by the Registrar by a notice given to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: begins on the date of expiry of the time limit; and
ends at the expiry of 1 month after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: earlier application (較早申請) means an earlier application referred to in section 37J(1)(a) or 37Z(1)(a) of the Ordinance, or an application under section 55(4) of the Ordinance to which the reference under section 55(1) of the Ordinance relates, as the case requires;

fulfilment date (符合日期) means the date—(a)that is the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) of the Ordinance is complied with; and(b)that is the date as notified to the applicant by a notice under section 31V(1) or (3) of these Rules; (L.N. 90 of 2025)
material date (關鍵日期) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Ordinance;

specified new application (指明新申請) means a new standard patent (O) application referred to in section 37J(2)(a) or 37Z(1)(b) of the Ordinance, or a new application referred to in section 55(4) of the Ordinance, as the case requires.

section.name: s31ZD
section.heading: Examination notice
section.content: If the Registrar gives a notice under section 37V(1) of the Ordinance in respect of a standard patent (O) application (examination notice), the Registrar must, in that notice, state that the applicant may respond to that notice in accordance with section 31ZE(1) of these Rules.

section.name: s31ZE
section.heading: Response to examination notice

subsection.content: A response to an examination notice to be filed for the purposes of section 37V(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance (response to examination notice) must be filed by the applicant with the Registrar within 4 months after the date of the notice.
If the applicant fails to comply with the requirement under subsection (1), the standard patent (O) application is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

section.name: s31ZF
section.heading: Further examination notice

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Registrar has considered the response.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, by notice given to the applicant under section 37V(1) of the Ordinance (further examination notice)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out any matter covered in the response to examination notice in respect of which the Registrar considers that elaboration, revision or clarification is required; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the applicant may file a further response in relation to the matter in accordance with section 31ZG(1) of these Rules to elaborate on, revise or clarify the matter.

subsection.content: The Registrar may give further examination notice more than once.

section.name: s31ZG
section.heading: Response to further examination notice

subsection.content: A response to a further examination notice to be filed for the purposes of section 37V(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance (response to further examination notice) must be filed by the applicant with the Registrar within 4 months after the date of the notice.
If the applicant fails to comply with the requirement under subsection (1), the standard patent (O) application is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: Section 31ZF of these Rules applies in relation to a response to further examination notice as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “a response to examination notice in accordance with section 31ZE(1)” in section 31ZF(1)(a) of these Rules were substituted by the words “a response to further examination notice in accordance with section 31ZG(1)”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the words “the response to examination notice” in section 31ZF(2)(a) of these Rules were substituted by the words “the response to further examination notice”.

section.name: s31ZH
section.heading: Provisional refusal notice

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar, having considered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a response to examination notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a response to further examination notice, if any,

subsection.continued: is of the opinion that the standard patent (O) application does not comply with the examination requirement concerned, the Registrar may make a provisional decision of refusal to grant the standard patent (O).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar makes a provisional decision, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant (provisional refusal notice)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the examination requirement concerned; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state that the applicant may respond to the provisional refusal notice by filing a request to review the Registrar’s opinion under section 37V(3)(c) of the Ordinance in accordance with section 31ZI(1) and (2) of these Rules.

section.name: s31ZI
section.heading: Request to review

subsection.content: A request to review the Registrar’s opinion under section 37V(3)(c) of the Ordinance (request to review) must be filed by the applicant with the Registrar within 2 months after the date of the provisional refusal notice.

subsection.leadIn: A request to review must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee for the request.

subsection.leadIn: A request to review may contain either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a representation to establish that the standard patent (O) application complies with the examination requirement concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a request to amend the application under section 31ZT of these Rules to achieve compliance with that requirement.

subsection.content: A request to review that does not comply with the requirements under subsection (1) or (2) is to be regarded as not having been made.

subsection.leadIn: If no request to review is filed, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a final decision of refusal to grant the standard patent (O); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the decision. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s31ZJ
section.heading: Review opinion
section.leadIn: If the Registrar, having considered a request to review, is of the opinion that the standard patent (O) application does not comply with the examination requirement concerned (review opinion), the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the review opinion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the examination requirement concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: state that the applicant may file a response to the review opinion in accordance with section 31ZK(1) of these Rules; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the Registrar thinks fit, and if applicable—state that the applicant may file a request for hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules in accordance with section 82(2)(a) of these Rules.

section.name: s31ZK
section.heading: Response to review opinion

subsection.content: A response to a review opinion to be filed for the purposes of section 37V(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance (response to review opinion) must be filed by the applicant with the Registrar within 2 months after the date of the review opinion.

If the review opinion states that the applicant may request a hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules, a request for hearing under that section may be filed within the period referred to in section 82(2)(a) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: A request for hearing must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee for the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If no response to review opinion is filed in accordance with subsection (1) and no request for hearing, if applicable, is filed in accordance with subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a final decision of refusal to grant the standard patent (O); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the decision. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s31ZL
section.heading: Further review opinion

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Registrar has considered—

subparagraph.content: a request to review filed by the applicant of a standard patent (O) application in accordance with section 31ZI(1) and (2) of these Rules; and
a response to review opinion filed by the applicant in accordance with section 31ZK(1) of these Rules, if any; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the applicant had requested a hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules—the hearing has been held.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, by notice given to the applicant (further review opinion)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: set out any matter covered in the following request, response and hearing, if any, in respect of which the Registrar considers that elaboration, revision or clarification is required—

subparagraph.content: the request to review;
the response to review opinion; and
the hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the applicant may file a further response in relation to the matter in accordance with section 31ZM(1) of these Rules to elaborate on, revise or clarify the matter; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Registrar thinks fit, and if applicable—state that the applicant may file a request for hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules in accordance with section 82(2)(b) of these Rules.

subsection.content: The Registrar may give further review opinion more than once.

section.name: s31ZM
section.heading: Response to further review opinion

subsection.content: A response to a further review opinion to be filed for the purposes of section 37V(3)(a) or (b) of the Ordinance (response to further review opinion) must be filed by the applicant with the Registrar within 2 months after the date of the further review opinion.

If the further review opinion states that the applicant may request a hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules, a request for hearing under that section may be filed within the period referred to in section 82(2)(b) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: A request for hearing must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee for the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If no response to further review opinion is filed in accordance with subsection (1) and no request for hearing, if applicable, is filed in accordance with subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a final decision of refusal to grant the standard patent (O); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the decision. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: Section 31ZL of these Rules applies in relation to a response to further review opinion as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “a response to review opinion filed by the applicant in accordance with section 31ZK(1) of these Rules” in section 31ZL(1)(a)(ii) of these Rules were substituted by the words “a response to review opinion and a response to further review opinion filed by the applicant in accordance with sections 31ZK(1) and 31ZM(1) of these Rules respectively”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the words “the response to review opinion” in section 31ZL(2)(a)(ii) of these Rules were substituted by the words “the response to review opinion and the response to further review opinion”.

section.name: s31ZN
section.heading: Final decision of refusal

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar, having considered the matters raised in the following request, responses and hearing, if any, is still of the opinion that the standard patent (O) application does not comply with the examination requirement concerned, the Registrar may make a final decision of refusal to grant the standard patent (O)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a request to review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a response to review opinion;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a response to further review opinion;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar makes the final decision, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the reasons for the decision.

section.name: s31ZO
section.heading: Continuing substantive examination on compliance with examination requirement concerned
section.content: If the Registrar is of the opinion that the examination requirement concerned has been complied with, the Registrar must continue to carry out the substantive examination of the standard patent (O) application.

section.name: s31ZP
section.heading: Grant and publication of standard patent (O)

subsection.content: The Registrar must, on being satisfied that a standard patent (O) can be granted under section 37X of the Ordinance, determine the date on which preparations for publication under section 37X(2)(a) of the Ordinance are to be regarded as having been completed. (L.N. 90 of 2025)
The Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the determination as soon as practicable after making the determination.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Provisions on Standard Patent (O) Applications before Grant

section.name: s31ZQ
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: request to review (覆核請求)—see section 31ZI(1) of these Rules;
response to examination notice (審查通知的回應)—see section 31ZE(1) of these Rules;
response to review opinion (覆核意見的回應)—see section 31ZK(1) of these Rules.

section.name: s31ZR
section.heading: Claim regarding non-prejudicial disclosure under section 37B(2)(b)(i) of Ordinance
section.leadIn: For the purposes of a claim regarding a disclosure that was due to, or in consequence of, an evident abuse under section 37B(2)(b)(i) of the Ordinance, a standard patent (O) application must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement stating that there has been an evident abuse as described in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: written evidence in support of the statement.

section.name: s31ZS
section.heading: Divisional standard patent (O) application under section 37Z of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A new standard patent (O) application referred to in section 37Z(1)(b) of the Ordinance (new application) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the new application is an application under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application number of the earlier application within the meaning of section 37Z(1)(a) of the Ordinance (earlier application).

subsection.content: If an earlier application is refused under section 37P(2) or (4)(b) or 37Y of the Ordinance, the applicant may file a new application within 2 months after the date of the notice under section 31Y(2) of these Rules or the date of the notice under section 31ZI(5), 31ZK(4), 31ZM(4) or 31ZN(2) of these Rules, as the case requires. (L.N. 90 of 2025)
If an appeal is made under section 130 of the Ordinance in relation to the refusal, the Registrar may specify a period within which a new application may be filed.
A new application is to be regarded as duly filed on the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) of the Ordinance is complied with. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s31ZT
section.heading: Request to amend standard patent (O) application before grant under section 37ZA(1) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 45(3) of these Rules, a request to amend a standard patent (O) application before grant under section 37ZA(1) of the Ordinance must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: identify the amendment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give the reasons for the amendment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 103(2) of the Ordinance, the applicant of a standard patent (O) application may request to amend the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when filing a request for substantive examination under section 37T(1) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: when filing with the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: a response to examination notice;
a response to further examination notice;
a request to review;
a response to review opinion; or
a response to further review opinion;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: once before preparations for publication of the application under section 37Q of the Ordinance are completed whether a request to amend the application has been filed under paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: within 3 months after the date of the notice issued under section 37U(1) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant requests to amend the description, claims or drawings in the specification contained in a standard patent (O) application (requested amendment), the Registrar may, if the Registrar thinks fit, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to file the following copies of the amended specification (required copies) with the Registrar within the period specified by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a clean copy of the specification with the requested amendment incorporated into it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the specification with the requested amendment incorporated into it and indicated in it.

subsection.content: If the required copies are not filed within the period specified under subsection (3), the request for amendment to which the required copies relate is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

For the purposes of subsections (1) and (3), the amendment of the standard patent (O) application must be prepared in compliance with the requirements specified in sections 31M(2) and (3), 31N, 31O, 31P, 31Q(2) to (12), 31R and 31S of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s31ZU
section.heading: Notice requesting reinstatement of standard patent (O) application under section 28(1) and (2) of Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD(1) of Ordinance
section.leadIn: A notice requesting reinstatement of a standard patent (O) application under section 28(1) and (2) of the Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD(1) of the Ordinance must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the additional prescribed fee for the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

section.name: s31ZV
section.heading: Application for restoration of rights lost in respect of standard patent (O) application under section 29(1) and (2) of Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD(1) of Ordinance
section.leadIn: An application for restoration of the rights lost in respect of a standard patent (O) application under section 29(1) and (2) of the Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD(1) of the Ordinance must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by the additional prescribed fee for the application for restoration of rights.

section.name: s31ZW
section.heading: Requirements concerning standard patent (O) application for invention requiring use of micro-organisms under section 149(2A) of Ordinance
section.content: Schedule 1 to these Rules has effect under section 149(2A) of the Ordinance in relation to a standard patent (O) application for an invention that requires the use of micro-organisms for the performance of the invention.

section.name: s31ZX
section.heading: Requirements concerning sequence listing in standard patent (O) application for invention involving nucleotide and amino acid sequences

subsection.content: A standard patent (O) application for an invention that involves nucleotide and amino acid sequences must contain a sequence listing as a part of the description in the specification contained in the application.

subsection.leadIn: A sequence listing must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements and standards adopted under the Patent Cooperation Treaty for the presentation of sequence listings in patent applications; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be filed—

subparagraph.content: with the Registrar; and
in electronic form, if so required by the Registrar.

subsection.content: A sequence listing filed in relation to a standard patent (O) application may be filed in electronic form even if the application is not filed by way of electronic filing under section 93A(2) of these Rules.

A sequence listing filed after the date of filing of the standard patent (O) application must be accompanied by a statement made by the applicant confirming to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the sequence listing does not contain any matter extending beyond the sequence disclosed in the application.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Renewal of standard patents

subsection.content: Payment of the renewal fee prescribed for the purposes of section 39(2) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing a request for renewal in the specified form accompanied by the renewal fee.
On receipt of the request for renewal duly completed and renewal fee, the Registrar shall issue a confirmation of payment.

Where the period for payment of a renewal fee pursuant to section 39(2) and (3) of the Ordinance has expired, the Registrar shall, not later than 6 weeks after the last date for payment under that section and if the fee still remains unpaid, send to the proprietor of the standard patent a notice reminding him that payment is overdue and of the consequences of non-payment.

subsection.leadIn: Notice to a proprietor under subsection (3) shall be sent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address in Hong Kong specified by the proprietor on payment of the last renewal fee;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the address for service entered in the register.

subsection.content: The late payment of a renewal fee in the manner provided for in section 39(4) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing a request for renewal in the specified form accompanied by the renewal fee and any additional fee prescribed for the purposes of that section.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Notification of lapsed standard patent
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a standard patent has ceased to have effect because a renewal fee has not been paid within the period specified in section 39(2) and (3) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extended period specified in section 39(4) of the Ordinance has expired without the renewal and prescribed additional fee having been paid,

section.continued: the Registrar shall, within 6 weeks after the expiration of the extended period, notify the proprietor of the patent of the fact and draw his attention to the provisions of section 40 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Restoration of lapsed standard patents under section 40 of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 40 of the Ordinance for the restoration of a standard patent which has ceased to have effect by reason of a failure to pay any renewal fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be in the specified form; and (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be accompanied by the fee prescribed for the purposes of that section.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The application must be accompanied by evidence to satisfy the Registrar that the applicant has taken all reasonable care required by the circumstances of the case for the purposes of section 40(4) of the Ordinance. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the application is not accompanied by the evidence, the Registrar must specify a period within which the evidence must be filed with the Registrar. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

If the Registrar, having considered the supporting evidence of the application, is not satisfied that a case for an order under section 40 of the Ordinance has been made out, he shall notify the applicant accordingly and, unless within 1 month the applicant requests to be heard in the matter, the Registrar shall refuse the application. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

If the applicant requests a hearing within the time allowed, the Registrar shall, after giving the applicant an opportunity of being heard, determine whether the application shall be allowed or refused.

If the Registrar, having considered the supporting evidence of the application, decides to allow the application, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to file a request for renewal with the Registrar within 2 months after the date of the notice. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The request for renewal must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a duly completed form specified for the purposes of section 39(2) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by any unpaid renewal fee and any additional fee prescribed for the purposes of section 40(4) of the Ordinance. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: On receiving the request for renewal filed in accordance with subsections (4) and (5), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the restoration of the standard patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the order by notice in the official journal. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Amendment of standard patent (R) under section 43 of Ordinance

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the amendment in the designated patent office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of grant of the standard patent (R), (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: A filing of documents with the Registrar for the purposes of section 43(1) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a verified copy of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amended specification; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amending order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice of the amendment in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such translations of the documents filed under paragraph (a) as may be required under section 56 of these Rules. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, if he thinks fit, require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amendment be shown on a copy of the specification of which amendment has been made in the designated patent office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the filing, within the time specified by the Registrar, of a new specification as amended, which shall be prepared in accordance with section 12 of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s36
section.heading: Prescribed opposition or revocation proceedings in designated patent office for purposes of sections 43 and 44 of Ordinance
section.content: The opposition or revocation proceedings in a designated patent office prescribed for the purposes of sections 43 and 44 of the Ordinance are, if the office is the European Patent Office, any post-grant opposition proceedings under or in accordance with Part V of the European Patent Convention.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Revocation of standard patent (R) under section 44 of Ordinance

subsection.content: A filing of documents with the Registrar for the purposes of section 44(2) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing those documents together with a notice, which shall be in the specified form, and such translations of the documents as may be required under section 56 of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 44(4) of the Ordinance for revocation of a standard patent (R) shall— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be supported by evidence of the statements made in the application and, where appropriate, shall be accompanied by a prescribed translation of such evidence in accordance with section 56 of these Rules; and (L.N. 402 of 1997; L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The documentation prescribed for the purposes of section 44(2) of the Ordinance is a verified copy of an entry in the patent register of the designated patent office showing the revocation of the designated patent.

A person who files an application under section 44(4) of the Ordinance shall, at the same time, send a copy of the application and any evidence and translation accompanying the application to every person registered as proprietor of the standard patent (R) and to every other person who is shown in the register as having a right in or under the patent. (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 35 of 2019)

Any recipient of such a copy of an application under subsection (4) who wishes to oppose the application shall, within 3 months from the date of receipt, file a counter-statement which shall be in the specified form, shall set out fully the grounds of objection to the application being opposed and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee. (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 35 of 2019)

The recipient shall, at the same time as he files the counter-statement, send a copy of it to each of the persons described in subsection (4) other than any person who is party to the counter-statement. (L.N. 37 of 2004)
The Registrar may give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s37A
section.heading: References to court under section 44(5) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if the Registrar decides to refer an application to the court for determination under section 44(5) of the Ordinance (reference to court).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, as soon as practicable after deciding to make the reference to court, give written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every party to the application known to the Registrar at the time of making the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar of the High Court.

subsection.content: If the person who made the application (applicant) wishes to commence proceedings before the court in relation to the application, the applicant must commence the proceedings within 1 month after the date of the written notice given under subsection (2).
If the applicant fails to commence proceedings in relation to the application under subsection (3), the applicant is to be treated as having abandoned the application.

As soon as practicable after being served with a copy of the originating summons by which proceedings in relation to the application are commenced under subsection (3), the Registrar must file with the court any document or other thing that was filed for the purpose of the application with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter in the register a notice of the reference to court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the reference to court by notice in the official journal.

subsection.content: Section 37(5) and (6) of these Rules does not apply after the Registrar has given written notice under subsection (2).

section.name: s38A
section.heading: Application to amend specification after grant

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an application under section 46 of the Ordinance to amend the specification of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a standard patent (O); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a short-term patent in respect of which a certificate of substantive examination has been issued.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.leadIn: a copy of the specification incorporating the requested amendment indicated by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: striking through the text, figure or other matter to be replaced or deleted; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: underlining the replacement text, figure or other matter;
the evidence furnished by the proprietor of the patent to establish the circumstances underlying the requested amendment; and
the prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the requested amendment must be prepared in compliance with the requirements specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O)—sections 31M(2) and (3), 31N, 31O, 31Q(2) to (12) and 31S of these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent—sections 58(2) and (3), 59, 60, 62(2) to (12) and 64 of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, by notice given to the proprietor of the patent, require the proprietor to do either or both of the following within the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: correct any deficiencies in the requested amendment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: file further evidence to supplement the evidence referred to in subsection (2)(b)(ii).

subsection.content: If the deficiencies mentioned in the notice are not corrected, or the further evidence required by the notice is not filed, within the period specified in the notice, the application is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, having regard to the evidence referred to in subsections (2)(b)(ii) and (4)(b), if any, and the circumstances underlying the requested amendment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to section 103(3) of the Ordinance, accept the requested amendment in whole or in part as an allowable amendment (allowable amendment); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse to accept the requested amendment.

subsection.content: If the Registrar accepts an allowable amendment under subsection (6)(a), the Registrar must, in addition to complying with section 46(3)(a) and (b) of the Ordinance, notify the proprietor of the patent of the Registrar’s decision.

subsection.leadIn: A request for a hearing under section 82(1) of these Rules made for the purposes of a decision under subsection (6) must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the prescribed fee for the request; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

section.name: s38B
section.heading: Opposition notice

subsection.content: Any person who intends to oppose an allowable amendment referred to in section 38A(6)(a) of these Rules and published under section 46(3)(a) of the Ordinance (opponent) may file an opposition notice with the Registrar.
The opposition notice must be filed within 1 month after the date on which the fact of the publication of the allowable amendment is advertised under section 46(3)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The opposition notice must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the facts on which the opponent relies; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the relief sought; and
the prescribed fee for the notice.

subsection.content: An opponent who files an opposition notice must, at the same time, send a copy of the opposition notice and statement to the proprietor of the patent.
The opponent must, within 3 days after the date of filing of the opposition notice, notify the Registrar in writing that the opponent has complied with subsection (4).
If the opponent fails to comply with the requirements under subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5), the opposition notice is to be regarded as not having been filed.

section.name: s38C
section.heading: Counter-statement

subsection.content: The proprietor of a patent who receives from an opponent referred to in section 38B of these Rules a copy of an opposition notice and intends to resist the opposition may file a counter-statement with the Registrar.
The counter-statement must be filed within 1 month after the date on which the copy of the opposition notice is received by the proprietor.

subsection.leadIn: The counter-statement must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the grounds on which the opposition is resisted; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the counter-statement.

subsection.content: A proprietor who files a counter-statement must, at the same time, send a copy of it to the opponent.

If the proprietor fails to file a counter-statement in accordance with the requirements under subsection (2) or (3), the application to amend the specification of the patent made in accordance with section 38A of these Rules is to be regarded as being withdrawn.
The proprietor or the opponent may request a hearing under section 82A(2) or (3) of these Rules.

section.name: s38D
section.heading: Directions by Registrar
section.content: In the proceedings concerning the application to amend the specification of a patent under section 46 of the Ordinance, the Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

section.name: s38E
section.heading: Final decision by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: If an opposition notice is filed under section 38B(1) of these Rules in opposition to an allowable amendment, and a counter-statement is filed under section 38C(1) of these Rules to resist the opposition, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must, before making a final decision under paragraph (b), consider—

subparagraph.content: the opposition notice and the statement referred to in section 38B(3)(b)(i) of these Rules;
the counter-statement;
the representation made at a hearing requested under section 82A(2) or (3) of these Rules, if any; and
the evidence furnished under section 38A(2)(b)(ii) and (4)(b) of these Rules, or in accordance with the directions given under section 38D of these Rules, if any; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must make a final decision to—

subparagraph.content: allow the allowable amendment in whole or in part as an allowed amendment; or
refuse to allow the allowable amendment.

subsection.content: If no opposition notice is filed in opposition to an allowable amendment, the Registrar must, having decided to allow the amendment in whole or in part, make a final decision to allow the amendment in whole or in part as an allowed amendment.

If a final decision is made under subsection (1)(b)(i) or (2), the Registrar must, in addition to complying with section 46(7)(a) and (b) of the Ordinance, notify the proprietor of the patent and the opponent referred to in section 38B(1) of these Rules, if any, of the final decision.

subsection.leadIn: If a final decision is made under subsection (1)(b)(ii), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the proprietor and the opponent of the final decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the final decision by notice in the official journal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: allowable amendment (可容許修訂) means a requested amendment—(a)accepted in whole or in part as an allowable amendment under section 38A(6)(a) of these Rules; and(b)published under section 46(3)(a) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s38F
section.heading: Publication of amendment under section 46(3)(a) or (7)(a) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies to the publication of an amendment under section 46(3)(a) or (7)(a) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, if the Registrar thinks fit, by notice given to the proprietor of the patent, require the proprietor to file, for the purposes of publishing the amendment, the following copies of the amended specification (required copies) with the Registrar within the period specified by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a clean copy of the specification with the amendment incorporated into it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the specification with the amendment incorporated into it and indicated in it.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the required copies must be prepared in compliance with the requirements specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O)—sections 31M(2) and (3), 31N, 31O, 31Q(2) to (12) and 31S of these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent—sections 58(2) and (3), 59, 60, 62(2) to (12) and 64 of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.content: If the required copies are not filed within the period specified under subsection (2), the application for amendment to which the required copies relate is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Surrender of patents

subsection.content: A notice of an offer by a proprietor of a patent under section 48 of the Ordinance to surrender his patent shall be in the specified form and details of any such notice given to the Registrar shall be advertised by the Registrar in the official journal. (2 of 2001 s. 19)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The proprietor of the patent who files the notice mentioned in subsection (1) must, at the same time as the notice is filed, send a copy of the notice to every other person who is shown in the register as having a right in or under the patent. (L.N. 90 of 2025)
Notice of opposition under section 48(2) of the Ordinance to the surrender of a patent may be given at any time within 2 months from the date of the advertisement.

subsection.leadIn: Such notice shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be supported by a statement setting out fully the facts upon which the opponent relies and the relief which he seeks; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee,

subsection.continued: and the opponent shall, at the same time as he files the notice, send a copy of the notice and of the statement to the proprietor of the patent. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: Within 3 months from the date on which the copy of the notice is received by the proprietor of the patent, the proprietor must, if the proprietor wishes to continue with the surrender, file a counter-statement which shall— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out fully the grounds of objection to the surrender being opposed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee,

subsection.continued: and the proprietor shall send a copy of the counter-statement to the opponent. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s40A
section.heading: References to court under section 48(4) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if the Registrar decides to refer a matter to the court for determination under section 48(4) of the Ordinance (reference to court).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, as soon as practicable after deciding to make the reference to court, give written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every party to the matter known to the Registrar at the time of making the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar of the High Court.

subsection.content: If the proprietor of the patent wishes to commence proceedings before the court in relation to the matter, the proprietor must commence the proceedings within 1 month after the date of the written notice given under subsection (2).
If the proprietor of the patent fails to commence proceedings in relation to the matter under subsection (3), the proprietor is to be treated as having abandoned the offer to surrender the patent.

As soon as practicable after being served with a copy of the originating summons by which proceedings in relation to the matter are commenced under subsection (3), the Registrar must file with the court any document or other thing that was filed for the purpose of the matter with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter in the register a notice of the reference to court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the reference to court by notice in the official journal.

subsection.content: Section 40(2), (3) and (4) of these Rules does not apply after the Registrar has given written notice under subsection (2).

section.name: s41
section.heading: References to Registrar under section 49(1) of Ordinance

subsection.content: A reference to the Registrar under section 49(1) of the Ordinance of the question mentioned in that section (which is, whether, having regard to any of the matters specified in section 9A(5) of the Ordinance, an invention is a patentable invention) must be made by filing in accordance with this section an application in the specified form (reference application).

subsection.leadIn: The reference application must be filed with the Registrar and accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement setting out—

subparagraph.content: the question on which the applicant intends to seek the determination of the Registrar;
the full particulars of the grounds and facts on which the applicant relies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the same time as the reference application is filed with the Registrar, send a copy of the reference application and of the accompanying statement to the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the reference application, notify the Registrar in writing that the applicant has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The reference application is to be treated as not having been filed in accordance with this section if the applicant fails to comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, as soon as practicable after the applicant has complied with subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter in the register a notice of the reference application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the filing of the reference application by notice in the official journal.

section.name: s41AA
section.heading: Notice of intention to oppose by person other than proprietor of patent

subsection.content: If a reference is made by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (reference application), any person (other than the proprietor of the patent) who intends to oppose the reference under section 49(4) of the Ordinance may file in accordance with this section a notice indicating the person’s intention to oppose the reference in the specified form (notice of intention to oppose).

The notice of intention to oppose must be filed with the Registrar within 28 days after the date on which the filing of the reference application is advertised in the official journal under section 41(5) of these Rules (filing period).

subsection.leadIn: A person who files with the Registrar a notice of intention to oppose (intending opponent) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the notice is filed, send a copy of the notice to—

subparagraph.content: the person who filed the reference application (applicant); and
the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the notice, notify the Registrar in writing that the intending opponent has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The notice of intention to oppose is to be treated as not having been filed in accordance with this section if the intending opponent fails to comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a copy of a notice of intention to oppose sent by an intending opponent under subsection (3)(a)(i), the applicant must, within 14 days after the expiry of the filing period—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: notify the Registrar in writing that the applicant has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The applicant is to be treated as having abandoned the reference if the applicant fails to comply with subsection (5).

section.name: s41AAB
section.heading: Notice of opposition by person other than proprietor of patent

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference is made by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (reference application);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a copy of the reference application and of the accompanying statement has been sent to the intending opponent under section 41AA(5) of these Rules,

subsection.continued: the intending opponent may, within 2 months after the expiry of the 14-day period specified in section 41AA(5) of these Rules, oppose the reference under section 49(4) of the Ordinance by filing with the Registrar a notice of opposition in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of opposition must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: set out—

subparagraph.content: the grounds on which the intending opponent relies in support of the opposition;
the facts alleged in the reference application that the intending opponent admits, denies or is unable to admit or deny; and
if the intending opponent denies a fact alleged in the reference application, the reasons for the denial; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The intending opponent must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the notice of opposition is filed with the Registrar, send a copy of the notice to—

subparagraph.content: the person who filed the reference application (applicant); and
the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the notice of opposition, notify the Registrar in writing that the intending opponent has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The intending opponent is to be treated as having abandoned the intention to oppose the reference if the intending opponent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not file a notice of opposition under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant receives from more than one intending opponent a copy of the notice of opposition sent under subsection (3) (received copy), the applicant must, within 3 days after the expiry of the 2-month period specified in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the received copy that the applicant received from each intending opponent to the other intending opponents; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the Registrar in writing that the applicant has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The applicant is to be treated as having abandoned the reference if the applicant fails to comply with subsection (5).

section.name: s41AAC
section.heading: Notice of opposition by proprietor of patent

subsection.leadIn: If a reference is made by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (reference application), the proprietor of the patent may oppose the reference under section 49(4) of the Ordinance by filing with the Registrar a notice of opposition in the specified form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a notice of intention to oppose is filed in accordance with section 41AA of these Rules in respect of the reference—within 2 months after the expiry of the 14-day period specified in section 41AA(5) of these Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no notice of intention to oppose is filed in accordance with section 41AA of these Rules in respect of the reference within the 28-day period specified in section 41AA(2) of these Rules—within 2 months after the expiry of that period.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of opposition must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: set out—

subparagraph.content: the grounds on which the proprietor of the patent relies in support of the opposition;
the facts alleged in the reference application that the proprietor admits, denies or is unable to admit or deny; and
if the proprietor denies a fact alleged in the reference application, the reasons for the denial; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of the patent must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the notice of opposition is filed with the Registrar, send a copy of the notice to—

subparagraph.content: the person who filed the reference application; and
if a notice of intention to oppose is filed in accordance with section 41AA of these Rules in respect of the reference, the person who filed the notice of intention to oppose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the notice of opposition, notify the Registrar in writing that the proprietor has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The reference is to be treated as unopposed by the proprietor of the patent if the proprietor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not file a notice of opposition under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with subsection (3).

section.name: s41AAD
section.heading: Evidence in support of reference

subsection.content: A person who makes a reference by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (applicant) must file evidence in support of the reference with the Registrar within 3 months after the expiry of the 2-month period specified in section 41AAB(1) or 41AAC(1)(a) or (b) of these Rules, whichever is applicable.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the evidence is filed under subsection (1), send a copy of the evidence to—

subparagraph.content: the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the evidence, notify the Registrar in writing that the applicant has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The applicant is to be treated as having abandoned the reference if the applicant fails to comply with subsection (1) or (2).

section.name: s41AAE
section.heading: Evidence in support of opposition

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of opposition is filed by a person (opponent) under section 41AAB(1) or 41AAC(1) of these Rules in respect of a reference made by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (reference application); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence in support of the reference is filed under section 41AAD(1) of these Rules by the person who filed the reference application (applicant).

subsection.leadIn: The opponent may, within 3 months after the date of the applicant’s filing of evidence under section 41AAD(1) of these Rules, file with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence in support of the opposition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that the opponent does not intend to file evidence.

subsection.leadIn: The opponent must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the evidence or statement is filed under subsection (2), send a copy of the evidence or statement to—

subparagraph.content: the applicant;
if the opponent is not the proprietor of the patent, the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the evidence or statement, notify the Registrar in writing that the opponent has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The evidence or statement is to be treated as not having been filed under subsection (2) if the opponent fails to comply with subsection (3).

section.name: s41AAF
section.heading: Additional evidence in reply to opposition

subsection.content: This section applies if evidence is filed by an opponent under section 41AAE(2) of these Rules in support of the opponent’s opposition to a reference made by an application filed in accordance with section 41 of these Rules (reference application).

subsection.leadIn: The person who filed the reference application (applicant) may, within 3 months after the expiry of the 3-month period specified in section 41AAE(2) of these Rules, file with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: additional evidence in support of the reference; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that the applicant does not intend to file additional evidence.

subsection.content: The additional evidence filed under subsection (2) must be confined to matters strictly in reply to the evidence filed under section 41AAE(2) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the same time as the additional evidence or statement is filed under subsection (2), send a copy of the additional evidence or statement to—

subparagraph.content: the proprietor of the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 3 days after the date of filing the additional evidence or statement, notify the Registrar in writing that the applicant has complied with the requirements of paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The additional evidence or statement is to be treated as not having been filed under subsection (2) if the applicant fails to comply with subsection (4).

section.name: s41AAG
section.heading: Filing of evidence that requires leave of Registrar
section.content: Except as provided in section 41AAD, 41AAE or 41AAF of these Rules, no evidence or further evidence may be filed by a party to the proceedings without the leave of the Registrar.

section.name: s41AAH
section.heading: Directions by Registrar
section.content: In the proceedings concerning a reference application mentioned in section 41(1) of these Rules, the Registrar may, either on the initiative of the Registrar or on request of a party to the proceedings, give any directions that the Registrar considers appropriate to regulate any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

section.name: s41AAI
section.heading: References to court under section 49(2)(b) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
