paragraph.content: a person (applicant) has filed a reference application in accordance with section 41 of these Rules seeking the Registrar’s determination on a question mentioned in that section (original reference); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar decides to refer the question to the court for determination under section 49(2)(b) of the Ordinance (reference to court).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, as soon as practicable after deciding to make the reference to court, give written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every party to the original reference known to the Registrar at the time of making the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar of the High Court.

subsection.content: If the applicant wishes to commence proceedings before the court in relation to the original reference, the applicant must commence the proceedings within 1 month after the date of the written notice given under subsection (2).
If the applicant fails to commence proceedings in relation to the original reference under subsection (3), the applicant is to be treated as having abandoned the original reference.

As soon as practicable after being served with a copy of the originating summons by which proceedings in relation to the original reference are commenced under subsection (3), the Registrar must file with the court any document or other thing that was filed for the purpose of the original reference with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter in the register a notice of the reference to court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advertise the fact of the reference to court by notice in the official journal.

subsection.content: Sections 41AA, 41AAB, 41AAC, 41AAD, 41AAE and 41AAF of these Rules do not apply after the Registrar has given written notice under subsection (2).

section.name: s41A
section.heading: Registrar to notify old proprietor etc. if order mentioned in section 55(4) or 56(2) of Ordinance is made

subsection.content: If a specified order is made in relation to a patent and is filed with the Registrar, the Registrar must, by notice given to each of the persons specified in subsection (2), notify the person of the order.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the old proprietor of the patent referred to in section 56(2) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the old proprietor of the original patent referred to in section 56(3A) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person whom the Registrar is aware of at the time of giving the notice is—

subparagraph.content: the licensee of the patent referred to in section 56(3) of the Ordinance; and
the licensee of the original patent referred to in section 56(3A) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A request for licence under section 56(3B)(b) of the Ordinance may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the old proprietor within 2 months after the date of the notice given to the old proprietor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the licensee within 4 months after the date of the notice given to the licensee.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: SpecifiedOrder
def.leadIn: specified order (指明命令), in relation to a patent, means an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made under section 55(4) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: referred to in section 56(2) of the Ordinance.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Property in Patents and Applications; Registration

section.name: s42
section.heading: Address for service in respect of patents

subsection.content: Every person concerned in any proceedings before the Registrar shall file an address for service.
The address for service must be a residential or business address in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person may file an address for service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person files any specified form that requires the person who completes it to provide an address for service, by filing the specified form with the address for service stated on it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, by notifying the Registrar in writing.

subsection.content: Where a specified form referred to in subsection (3)(a) is filed in the name of 2 or more persons, the address for service stated on that form shall be treated as the address for service of each of those persons.
An applicant for a patent or the proprietor of a patent may use only one address for service for the purposes of all proceedings before the Registrar concerning that application or patent.

Subject to any filing to the contrary under this section, on the grant of an application for a patent, the address for service of the applicant shall be treated as the address for service of the proprietor of the patent for the purposes of all proceedings before the Registrar concerning that patent.

Where a person files an address for service for the purposes of any proceedings before the Registrar, that address shall be treated as being in substitution for any address for service previously filed by that person for the purposes of those proceedings.

Where, after a person has become a party to proceedings before the Registrar, the person appoints an agent for the first time or appoints one agent in substitution for another, the newly appointed agent shall file an address for service.

No act required or authorized by the Ordinance or these Rules to be done by or to a person referred to in subsection (8) in connection with the proceedings in question may be done by or to the newly appointed agent before the date on which he files an address for service.
Any person may withdraw his address for service by notifying the Registrar in writing.

section.name: s42A
section.heading: Failure to file address for service

subsection.content: Where an address for service is not filed as required by section 42 of these Rules, or where the Registrar is satisfied that the address for service of the proprietor of a patent or a party to any proceedings before the Registrar is no longer valid, the Registrar may send to the person concerned, at any of the addresses referred to in subsection (2), a notice to file an address for service. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the addresses are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any previously filed address for service of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any address of the person in Hong Kong that is shown in the register;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any residential or business address of the person in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other address of the person that is known to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If any person to whom a notice is sent under subsection (1) fails to file an address for service within 2 months after the date of the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any application (other than an application for a patent), notice or request filed by that person shall be treated as abandoned or withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person shall be deemed to have withdrawn from any proceedings before the Registrar of which he is a party (other than as an applicant for a patent).

subsection.content: This section is without prejudice to the operation of sections 17, 31Y and 68 of these Rules. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Entries in the register

subsection.leadIn: No entry is to be made in the register—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O) application—before the application is published in accordance with section 37Q of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent application—before the short-term patent is granted. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: On the publication of the request to record for the standard patent (R) application, the publication of the standard patent (O) application, or the grant of the short-term patent, the Registrar must cause to be entered in the register— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the applicant or proprietor, as the case requires; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the title of the invention;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the application for the patent and the application number;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date of filing and the application number of any application declared for the purposes of section 11B, 37E or 111 of the Ordinance and the country, territory or area in or for which the application was made; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to a standard patent (R) application—the date of filing and the application number of the corresponding designated patent application; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the date of publication of the request to record for the standard patent (R) application, the date of publication of the standard patent (O) application, or the date of grant of the short-term patent, as the case requires; and (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the address for service of the applicant or proprietor, as the case requires. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar shall also cause to be entered in the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a patent, published request to record for a standard patent (R) application, or published standard patent (O) application— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: notice of any transaction, instrument or event referred to in section 52(3) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any standard patent or standard patent application, in addition to the matters specified in paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to a standard patent (R) application—the date of grant of the corresponding designated patent; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the standard patent is granted;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the name and address of the person or persons to whom the standard patent is granted, if different to the entry made in accordance with subsection (2)(a).

subsection.content: The Registrar may at any time enter in the register such other particulars as he may think fit.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Entries relating to section 13(1) or 37H(1) of Ordinance
section.content: On the reference to the Registrar of a question under section 13(1) or 37H(1) of the Ordinance the Registrar shall, subject to section 43(1) of these Rules, cause an entry to be made in the register of the fact and of such other information relating to the reference as he may think fit.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Alteration of name or address

subsection.content: A request by any person, upon the alteration of his name, for that alteration to be entered in the register or on any application or other document filed at the registry shall be in the specified form.
Before acting on a request to alter a name, the Registrar may require such proof of the alteration as he thinks fit.

A request by any person for the alteration or correction of his address or address for service entered in the register or on any application or other document filed with the Registrar shall be made in the specified form or by notice in writing and shall identify any relevant application or patent to which the request relates. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

If the Registrar is satisfied that a request to alter a name or to alter or correct an address or address for service may be allowed, he shall cause the register, application or other document to be altered accordingly.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Registration of transactions, etc., in relation to patents and patent applications

subsection.content: An application to register, or a notice to the Registrar of, any transaction, instrument or event to which section 52 of the Ordinance applies shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: An application or a notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where it relates to an assignment referred to in section 52(3)(a) or (c) of the Ordinance, be signed by or on behalf of the assignor; (L.N. 37 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it relates to a mortgage or the granting of a licence or sub-licence or security referred to in section 52(3)(b) or (c) of the Ordinance, be signed by or on behalf of the mortgagor or the grantor of the licence or security, as the case may be,

subsection.continued: or, if not so signed, shall be accompanied by such documentary evidence as suffices to establish the transaction, instrument or event.

subsection.content: The Registrar may direct that such evidence as he may require in connection with the application or notice shall be sent to him within such period as he may specify.

An application or a notice under subsection (1) may be rejected only in the event of failure to comply with the conditions laid down in subsection (2) or (3) or, where appropriate, in section 50(6) of the Ordinance and, if so rejected, the application will not be considered as an application or a notice for the purposes of section 52(1) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Request for correction of error in register or in any document filed in connection with registration

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 45(3) of these Rules, a request for the correction of an error in the register or in any document filed with the Registrar in connection with registration shall— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The Registrar may call for such written explanation of the reasons for the request or evidence in support of it as he may require in order to satisfy himself that there is an error and, upon being so satisfied, shall make such correction as may be agreed between the proprietor of the patent or applicant and the Registrar.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Correction of errors in patents and applications under section 146 of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Except where section 45(3) of these Rules has effect, a request for the correction of an error of translation or transcription or of a clerical error or mistake in any specification of a patent, in an application for a patent or in any document filed in connection with a patent or such an application shall— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: clearly identify the proposed correction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the prescribed fee,

subsection.continued: and the Registrar may, if he thinks fit, require that the correction be shown on a copy of the document of which correction is sought.

subsection.content: Where such a request relates to a specification, no correction shall be made in the specification unless the correction is obvious in the sense that it is immediately evident that nothing else would have been intended than what is offered as the correction.
Where the Registrar requires notice of the proposed correction to be advertised, he shall advertise the request and the nature of the proposed correction in the official journal. (2 of 2001 s. 19)
At any time within 2 months after the date of the advertisement, any person may give notice to the Registrar of opposition to the request.

Such notice shall be in the specified form, shall be supported by a statement setting out fully the facts on which the opponent relies and the relief which he seeks and shall be accompanied by the prescribed fee. (L.N. 37 of 2004)
The opponent shall, at the same time as he files the notice, send a copy of the notice and the statement to the person making the request. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: If the person making the request desires to proceed with the request, the person must, within 3 months after the date on which the copy of the notice is received by the person— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: file a counter-statement in the specified form setting out fully the grounds on which he contests the opposition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: send a copy of the counter-statement to the opponent. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.content: The Registrar may give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s50
section.heading: Inspection of register

subsection.content: The register, or entries or reproductions of entries in it, shall be made available for inspection by the public during the hours of business of the registry as published in accordance with section 148 of the Ordinance.
A copy of an entry in or extract from the register shall be requested only in accordance with section 51 of these Rules. (L.N. 35 of 2019; L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s51
section.heading: Certificates and copies supplied by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: Upon written request made in the specified form and payment of the prescribed fee, but subject to subsection (3), the Registrar shall supply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified copy or certified extract falling within section 51(11) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate for the purposes of section 51(10) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: Upon written request and payment of the prescribed fee, if any, but subject to subsection (3), the Registrar shall supply an uncertified copy of an entry in or an uncertified extract from the register or an uncertified copy of or an uncertified extract from anything referred to in section 51(11)(b) of the Ordinance.

The restrictions on making documents available for inspection contained in section 89(1) of these Rules shall apply equally to the supply by the Registrar under this section of copies of or extracts from such documents or requests as are referred to in section 89(1) of these Rules, and nothing in this section shall be construed as imposing upon the Registrar the duty of supplying copies of or extracts from any document or file of a description referred to in section 89(2) of these Rules. (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s52
section.heading: Filing of court orders, declarations, directions or certificates

subsection.content: If the court has made an order, declaration or direction, or has granted a certificate, under the Ordinance (except under section 46 or 102 of the Ordinance) in favour of a person, the person or, if there is more than one such person, the person directed by the court, must file a sealed copy of the order, declaration, direction or certificate with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If the court makes any order under section 46 or 102 of the Ordinance in favour of a person, the person or, if there is more than one such person, the person directed by the court, must file with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of any documents referred to in the order that show the amendments to be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the translations of those documents as may be required under section 56 of these Rules.

subsection.content: The documents and translations referred to in subsection (2) must be filed at the time when a copy of the order is filed with the Registrar in accordance with a provision of the order under section 46 or 102 of the Ordinance or a direction made by the court or rules of court.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Time limit for application under section 58 of Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the period prescribed for the purposes of section 58(1) and (2) of the Ordinance shall be that period which begins when the relevant patent is granted and expires one year after the relevant patent has ceased to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: Where a patent has ceased to have effect by reason of a failure to pay any renewal fee within the period prescribed for the payment of that fee and an application for restoration is made under section 40 or 127 of the Ordinance, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if restoration is ordered, the period specified in subsection (1) shall continue as if the patent had remained continuously in effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if restoration is refused, the period specified in subsection (1) shall be treated as expiring one year after the patent ceased to have effect or 6 months after the refusal, whichever is the later.

section.name: s53A
section.heading: Single inventive concept

subsection.content: For the purposes of the Ordinance, if a technical relationship existing between 2 or more inventions involves one or more of the same or corresponding special technical features, the inventions are to be regarded as being so linked as to form a single inventive concept.

For the purposes of subsection (1), special technical features are the technical features that define a contribution that each of the claimed inventions, considered as a whole, makes over the prior art.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Prescribed opposition or revocation proceedings in designated patent office for purposes of section 91(1)(i) of Ordinance
section.content: The opposition or revocation proceedings in a designated patent office prescribed for the purposes of section 91(1)(i) of the Ordinance are, if the office is the European Patent Office, any post-grant opposition proceedings under or in accordance with Part V of the European Patent Convention.

section.name: s56
section.heading: The language of proceedings before the Registrar

subsection.content: Except as expressly provided in these Rules, where any document or part of a document which is not in one of the official languages is filed with the Registrar or sent to the registry in pursuance of the Ordinance or these Rules, it shall contain a translation into the language of the proceedings, and such translation shall state the name of the translator and his official capacity, if any. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 15(3), 23(4), 37L(4) and 113(3) of the Ordinance and sections 8, 19, 31M and 58 of these Rules— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the title of the invention and the abstract, if not in one of the official languages, shall contain a translation into both official languages;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names of the applicant and inventor, if not in the Roman alphabet or in Chinese characters, shall contain a transliteration of the same in the Roman alphabet. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 15(2)(d), 23(3)(b), 37L(3)(c) and 113(2)(c) of the Ordinance, if any documents supporting the respective statements under sections 15(2)(d), 23(3)(b), 37L(3)(c) and 113(2)(c) of the Ordinance are not in one of the official languages, they shall contain a translation into the language of the proceedings. (L.N. 35 of 2019)
A translation into the language of the proceedings or into one of the official languages of the designated patent application as referred to in section 15(2)(a) of the Ordinance will not be required.

A translation into the language of the proceedings or into one of the official languages of the published specification of the designated patent as referred to in section 23(3)(a) of the Ordinance will not be required.

subsection.leadIn: Any party in oral proceedings before the Registrar, or any witness or expert called by any such party to give evidence in such proceedings, may use in those proceedings a language other than the language of the proceedings if, and only if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the party makes such provision for interpretation into the language of the proceedings as the Registrar may require;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the party complies with any requirement as the Registrar may specify as to interpretation of the oral proceedings into the other official language and as to the expenses of that interpretation.

subsection.content: Subject to the consent of the parties concerned, the Registrar may in any proceedings before him, on such terms as he thinks fit, give directions relating to the use of the official language that is not the language of the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, in respect of any document to be used for the purposes of evidence in proceedings before the Registrar and which is in a language other than the language of the proceedings, give directions as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the filing of the document in that other language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the filing of a translation of the document into the language of the proceedings.

subsection.content: The Registrar may specify periods within which any translation of a document is to be filed or within which information in the official languages is to be provided; and the Registrar may, upon application by a party to the proceedings, extend such periods as he may think fit subject to the payment of a penalty fee.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (9) does not apply if the translation is required to be filed with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within a prescribed time or period under these Rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a specified period as referred to in these Rules other than that subsection; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a notice given under section 17, 24, 31Y(1) or 68(1) of these Rules. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the request of the applicant or proprietor, if he is satisfied that there is good reason for such request, direct that the official language which is not being used as the language of the proceedings for the purposes of section 104 of the Ordinance shall become and shall be used as the language of the proceedings, and his direction shall have effect accordingly.

section.name: s56A
section.heading: General provisions for sections 56B and 56C of these Rules

subsection.leadIn: Sections 56B and 56C of these Rules apply to any of the following applications that is in neither English nor Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an earlier specified application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a previous application.

subsection.leadIn: In this section and sections 56B and 56C of these Rules—
subsection.def: earlier specified application (較早前提出的指明申請) means an earlier specified application referred to in section 37M(3)(c)(ii) or 114(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance;
previous application (過往的申請) means a previous application referred to in section 37E(1) or 111(1) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s56B
section.heading: Language requirements for sections 37E(1), 37M(3)(c)(ii), 111(1) and 114(3)(c)(ii) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 111(1) of the Ordinance, the applicant for the short-term patent must file the document specified in subsection (2) with the Registrar within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Registrar approves the restoration application under section 68B of these Rules—a period specified by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The document is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a translation of the title of the invention, the claims and the filing date of the previous application together with a transliteration of the name of the applicant into the Roman alphabet; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the short-term patent application for which priority is claimed is a translation of the previous application—a statement made by the translator verifying to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the translation is complete and accurate.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 37M(3)(c)(ii) and 114(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance, the applicant must file the following document with the Registrar within 4 months after the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 37M(3) or 114(3) of the Ordinance, as the case requires, is complied with— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a translation of the earlier specified application in the language of the proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any description or drawing that is a translation of the description or drawing of the earlier specified application has been filed under section 37L(2)(b)(i) or (iii) or 113(1A)(b)(i) or (iii) of the Ordinance—a statement made by the translator verifying to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the translation is complete and accurate. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: If the requirement under subsection (1) or (3) is not complied with, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for section 111(1) or 114(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance—by notice given to the applicant referred to in section 68(1) of these Rules, require the applicant to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 37E(1) and 111(1) of the Ordinance, the Registrar may, by a notice under section 31ZD, 31ZF(2), 31ZJ, 31ZL(2), 81D(1), 81F(2), 81J or 81L(2) of these Rules, require the applicant for a standard patent (O) or the proprietor of a short-term patent to file the following document with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a translation of the previous application in the language of the specification of the standard patent (O) application or the short-term patent, as the case requires; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the standard patent (O) application or the short-term patent for which priority is claimed is a translation of the previous application—a statement made by the translator verifying to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the translation is complete and accurate.

section.name: s56C
section.heading: Language requirements for sections 37N(5) and 114A(5) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of filing a missing description or missing drawing under sections 37N(5) and 114A(5) of the Ordinance, the applicant must file the following documents with the Registrar within the period specified under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a translation of the previous application in the language of the specification of the standard patent (O) application or the short-term patent application, as the case requires; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement indicating which part of the translation represents the description or drawing that is missing in the patent application.

subsection.leadIn: The period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the applicant is required to file the missing description or missing drawing by a notice under section 37N(1) or 114A(1) of the Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: 2 months after the date of the notice; or
16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant files the missing description or missing drawing on the applicant’s own initiative under section 37N(2) or 114A(2) of the Ordinance—16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

section.name: s56D
section.heading: Registrar may require evidence on accuracy of translations

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar has reasonable doubts about the accuracy of any translation of a document that has been filed by any person in accordance with the Ordinance or these Rules, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must notify the person of the reasons for the Registrar’s doubts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may require the person to file the following documents with the Registrar within the period specified by the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: an accurate translation of the document;
evidence to establish that the translation is accurate.

subsection.content: If the person fails to comply with the requirement under subsection (1)(b), the document is to be regarded as not having been filed.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Filing of corrected translation under section 106(3) of Ordinance

subsection.content: Section 12 of these Rules shall apply in relation to a corrected translation filed under section 106(3) of the Ordinance as it applies in relation to the documents making up a request to record. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

Payment of the fee prescribed for the purposes of section 106(3) of the Ordinance in connection with the publication of the corrected translation shall be made by filing a request for publication in the specified form accompanied by the fee.
The period prescribed for payment of the prescribed fee for the purposes of section 106(3) of the Ordinance shall be 14 days from the day on which the corrected translation is filed.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Applications for grant of short-term patents under section 113 of Ordinance

subsection.content: An application for the grant of a short-term patent made under section 113 or 125 of the Ordinance shall be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The specification contained in an application for a short-term patent shall state the title of the invention and include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the invention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or more claims but not exceeding 2 independent claims; (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any drawings referred to in the description or the claim or claims. (L.N. 48 of 2002)

subsection.content: The title shall be short and indicate the matter to which the invention relates.

subsection.leadIn: The application for the grant of a short-term patent shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a search report as prescribed in section 72 of these Rules; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an applicant claiming priority of a previous application under section 111 of the Ordinance, a statement of priority as prescribed by section 69 of these Rules and a copy of the previous application; (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any request for deferral of the grant of a patent for a specified period under section 119 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any statement required by section 109 of the Ordinance in relation to non-prejudicial disclosure of the invention referred to in paragraph (b) of that section, together with written evidence in support of the statement as prescribed in section 70 of these Rules;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the name and address of the inventor or inventors;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a list of the documents comprising the application and an indication of the number of sheets of each such document; (L.N. 35 of 2019)
for a reference to an earlier specified application under section 114(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance—the documents required under section 67A(3) of these Rules; (L.N. 35 of 2019; L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the translation of documents and transliteration of names required under sections 56, 56A and 56B of these Rules; and (L.N. 35 of 2019; L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: in the case of a new application for a patent made in compliance with an order under section 55(4) of the Ordinance—the number of the patent that has been conditionally or unconditionally revoked by the court. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s59
section.heading: Description

subsection.content: This section applies to a description referred to in section 113(1A)(b)(i) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a short-term patent application. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The description—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify the technical field to which the invention relates;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: must disclose the invention in a way that the following can be understood—

subparagraph.content: the technical problem to which the invention relates (even if not so expressly stated); and
the solution to the problem;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must state any advantageous effects of the invention with reference to the background art;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: must briefly describe the figures in the drawings, if any, referred to in—

subparagraph.content: the description; or
the claim or claims contained in the specification of the application;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: must indicate the way in which the invention is industrially applicable, if it is not obvious from the description or nature of the invention. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.content: The description must be presented in the manner and order specified in subsection (2) unless not doing so is conducive to a better understanding of the invention because of its nature and a more economical presentation. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s60
section.heading: Drawings referred to in description or claim

subsection.content: This section applies to the drawings referred to in the description or the claim or claims under section 113(1A)(b)(iii) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a short-term patent application.

subsection.leadIn: The drawings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be on sheets each of which—

subparagraph.content: has a usable surface area not exceeding 26.2 cm × 17 cm;
does not contain frames round the usable or used surface; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: from the top—2.5 cm;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: from the left—2.5 cm;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: from the right—1.5 cm; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: from the bottom—1 cm; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be executed in the following manner—

subparagraph.content: the scale and distinctness of graphical execution must enable all details of the drawings to be distinguished without difficulty in a photographic reproduction of the drawings with a linear reduction in size to two-thirds of the drawings;
if, as an exception, a scale is given, the scale must be represented graphically;
all numbers, letters and reference signs must be simple and clear;
brackets, circles and inverted commas must not be used in association with numbers, letters and characters;
all lines must ordinarily be drawn with the aid of drafting instruments;
the height of the numbers, letters and characters must not be less than 0.32 cm;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Latin alphabets; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if customary—Greek alphabets or Chinese characters, as appropriate;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the same sheet of drawings contains several figures, the figures must be—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: arranged without wasting space and clearly separated from one another; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals, independently of the numbering of the sheets;

if the figures drawn on 2 or more sheets are intended to form one whole figure, the figures on the sheets must be so arranged that the whole figure can be assembled without concealing any part of the partial figures;
reference signs not mentioned in the description and claims must not appear;
reference signs not mentioned in the drawings must not appear in the description and claims;
the same features, when denoted by reference signs, must be denoted by the same signs throughout the application;

subparagraph.leadIn: the drawings must not contain any textual matter, except—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: if required for a clear understanding of the drawings—the textual matter is a single word or words or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate; and

statutoryNote.heading: Example—
statutoryNote.content: Examples of the single word or words are “water”, “steam”, “open”, “close” and “section on AA”.

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: for electric circuits and block schematic or flow sheet diagrams, the textual matter is—

subparagraph.content: a few short catchwords or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate, that are required for a clear understanding of the drawings; and
placed in a way that it can, if required, be replaced by its translations without interfering with any lines; and
the sheets of the drawings must be numbered in accordance with section 62(3)(e)(ii) of these Rules.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: drawing (繪圖) includes a flow sheet and a diagram. Note— Section 62(13) of these Rules provides for exemption from this section.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Abstract

subsection.content: This section applies to an abstract referred to in section 113(1A)(c) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a short-term patent application.

subsection.leadIn: The abstract must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contain a concise summary of the matters contained in the specification referred to in section 113(1A)(b) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: normally, not contain more than 150 words or 200 Chinese characters, as appropriate;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: not contain statements on the alleged merits or value of the invention or on its speculative application.

subsection.leadIn: The summary referred to in subsection (2)(a) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify the technical field to which the invention relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be written in a way that allows a clear understanding of—

subparagraph.content: the technical problem to which the invention relates;
the gist of the solution to the problem through the invention; and
the principal use or uses of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: If the specification provides for drawings—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the Registrar considers that any other figure or figures better characterize the invention—the Registrar may decide to publish the other figure or figures; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each main feature of the invention stated in the abstract and illustrated by a drawing must be followed by the reference sign relating to the feature used in that drawing, placed between parentheses.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Size and presentation of documents

subsection.content: This section applies to the documents comprising a short-term patent application to be filed under section 113(1)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must be presented in a manner that it may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reproduced in an unlimited number of copies by photography, photocopying processes, photo offset and microfilming; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: scanned by a device capable of capturing an image of the document and converting the image into a form suitable for storage on, and retrieval by, a computer.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be free from cracks, creases and folds;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be single-sided;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be on A4 papers (29.7 cm × 21 cm) that are pliable, strong, white, smooth, matt and durable;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not share a sheet with another document; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the document has more than one sheet, comprise sheets that are—

subparagraph.content: connected in a way that the sheets can easily be turned over, separated and combined again; and
numbered in consecutive Arabic numerals.

subsection.leadIn: The description, claims and abstract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not contain drawings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain chemical or mathematical formulae;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (5)—may contain tables; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (6)—must be typed or printed.

subsection.content: The claims may contain tables only if their subject matter makes the use of tables desirable.
If necessary, graphic symbols and chemical or mathematical formulae may be drawn or written by hand.
All textual matters in the description, claims and abstract must be in black and indelible.

subsection.leadIn: The tables and chemical or mathematical formulae—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b)—must be presented in an upright position on a sheet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if they cannot be presented satisfactorily in an upright position on a sheet—may be presented sideways on the sheet in a way that the top of the tables or formulae are at the left side of the sheet.

subsection.leadIn: In the documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: weights and measures must be expressed in metric units, whether or not they are also expressed in other units;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other physical values must be expressed in the units recognized in international practice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: chemical or mathematical formulae must be stated by employing the symbols, atomic weights and molecular formulae in general use; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: technical terms, signs and symbols generally accepted in the field in question must generally be used.

subsection.content: If a formula or symbol is used in the specification, a copy of the specification, prepared in the same manner as drawings, must be furnished if the Registrar so directs.
Terminology and signs must be consistent throughout the application.

subsection.leadIn: All documents must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: legible; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reasonably free from deletions and other alterations, overwritings and interlineations.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may exempt a document from any requirement under this section and section 60 of these Rules if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authenticity of the content of the document is not in question and the requirements for good reproduction are not in jeopardy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar considers that there are other circumstances that justify the exemption.

subsection.content: Regardless of any exemption granted under subsection (13), in the case of an application for a short-term patent based on an international application under section 125 of the Ordinance, the documents comprising the international application are taken as complying with this section.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Form of statements, counter-statements and evidence
section.content: Subject to the Registrar’s direction, any statement, counter-statement or evidence to be filed with the Registrar must comply with the requirements under section 62(2) and (3)(c) of these Rules as if those requirements applied to the statement, counter-statement or evidence.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Claims

subsection.content: This section applies to the claims referred to in section 113(1A)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance of an invention that is the subject of a short-term patent application.
The claims must define the matter for which protection is sought in terms of the technical features of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: If appropriate, an independent claim must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement indicating—

subparagraph.content: the designation of the subject matter of the invention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a characterizing portion, preceded by the expression “characterized in that” or “characterized by” or the equivalent Chinese characters, as appropriate, stating the technical features that, in combination with the technical features referred to in paragraph (a)(ii), the claim seeks to protect.

subsection.content: An independent claim stating the essential features of an invention may be followed by one or more dependent claims concerning particular embodiments of the invention (dependent claim).

subsection.leadIn: A dependent claim that includes all the features of any other claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain a reference to that other claim, at the beginning if possible;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the additional features that the dependent claim seeks to protect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is admissible even if it directly refers to another claim that is also a dependent claim.

subsection.content: Dependent claims referring to a single or several previous claims must be grouped together according to the previous claims in the most appropriate way.
The number of the claims must, having regard to the nature of the invention claimed, be reasonable.
If there are 2 or more claims, the claims must be numbered consecutively in Arabic numerals.

subsection.leadIn: A claim must not rely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on references to the description or drawings in respect of the technical features of the invention unless it is absolutely necessary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in particular, on the following references or references similar to the following references—

subparagraph.content: “as described in part ... of the description”;
“as illustrated in figure ... of the drawings”;
“如說明第……部分所描述”; or
“如繪圖的附圖……所示”.

subsection.content: For an application that contains drawings, the technical features stated in the claims may be followed by the reference signs relating to the features used in the drawings, if doing so makes the claims easier to understand.

subsection.leadIn: The reference signs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be placed between parentheses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not to be construed as limiting the claims.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Procedure where applicant is not the inventor or sole inventor
section.leadIn: Where the applicant or applicants are not the inventor or inventors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statement required by section 113(2)(c) of the Ordinance shall be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar shall send a copy of the statement to each inventor who is not one of the applicants. (L.N. 37 of 2004)

section.name: s66
section.heading: Issue of receipt by Registrar
section.leadIn: On first receipt of any of the documents comprising an application for a short-term patent, the Registrar shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mark the documents with the date of their receipt by him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assign an application number to the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant a receipt which shows an application number, the nature and number of the documents received and the date of their receipt.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Notice after examination of minimum requirement under section 114 of Ordinance

subsection.content: If a short-term patent application complies with the requirement specified in section 114(3) of the Ordinance (minimum requirement), the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the earliest date on which the minimum requirement is complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If the application does not comply with the minimum requirement, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the deficiencies in the application as regards the non-compliance with the minimum requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that unless the applicant corrects the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice, the application is not to be dealt with as a short-term patent application.

subsection.content: If the applicant corrects the deficiencies within the period referred to in subsection (2)(b), the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant, notify the applicant of the earliest date on which the minimum requirement is complied with.

section.name: s67A
section.heading: Requirements for making reference to earlier specified application referred to in section 114(3)(c)(ii) of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if a short-term patent application contains a purported reference to an earlier specified application referred to in section 114(3)(c)(ii) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the minimum requirement under section 114(3) of the Ordinance, a reference to an earlier specified application is not to be regarded as having been made unless the reference states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the earlier specified application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application number of the earlier specified application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the country, territory or area in or for which the earlier specified application was made.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must file the following documents with the Registrar within 4 months after the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 114(3) of the Ordinance is complied with— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the earlier specified application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the certificate issued by the authority that received the earlier specified application (certificate).

subsection.content: If the earlier specified application is an application made under the Ordinance, the copies referred to in subsection (3)(a) and (b) are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.
If the earlier specified application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese, sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(3) of these Rules apply to it.

If a copy of the earlier specified application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(3) of these Rules as applied by subsection (5) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

section.name: s67B
section.heading: Filing for purposes of section 114A of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: If a missing description or missing drawing is required by a notice under section 114A(1) of the Ordinance to be filed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must be filed within 2 months after the date of the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the previous application documents must be filed for the purposes of section 114A(5)(d) of the Ordinance within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.leadIn: If a missing description or missing drawing is to be filed on an applicant’s own initiative under section 114A(2) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must be filed within 2 months after the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 114(3) of the Ordinance is compiled with; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the previous application documents must be filed for the purposes of section 114A(5)(d) of the Ordinance within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.content: If the previous application referred to in section 114A(5)(a) of the Ordinance is an application made under the Ordinance, a copy of the previous application is to be regarded as having been filed in due time for the purposes of section 114A(5)(d) of the Ordinance.
If the previous application is in neither English nor Chinese, sections 56A and 56C of these Rules apply to it.

If a copy of the previous application or the translation required by sections 56A and 56C of these Rules as applied by subsection (4) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: missing description (欠交說明) has the meaning given by section 114A(6) of the Ordinance;
missing drawing (欠交繪圖) has the meaning given by section 114A(6) of the Ordinance;

def.name: PreviousApplicationDocuments
def.leadIn: previous application documents (過往申請的文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copy of the previous application referred to in section 114A(5)(d)(i) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement referred to in section 114A(5)(d)(iii) of the Ordinance indicating which part of the previous application represents the description or drawing that is missing in the short-term patent application.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Examination on Formal Requirements of Short-term Patent Applications

section.name: s68
section.heading: Correction of deficiencies in short-term patent application as regards formal requirements

subsection.leadIn: If an examination under section 115(1) of the Ordinance reveals deficiencies in a short-term patent application as regards the formal requirements within the meaning of that section, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the deficiencies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the applicant to correct the deficiencies within 2 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused or is to be regarded as being withdrawn under section 115(1A) or (3) of the Ordinance, the Registrar must, by notice given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the refusal or withdrawal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the reasons for the refusal or withdrawal.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Procedure up to and including Grant of Short-term Patents

section.name: s68A
section.heading: Extension of time for filing search report and paying filing fee or advertisement fee

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the only deficiency in the short-term patent application is the failure to file a search report as required by section 113(1A)(d) of the Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the applicant may request an extension of time for filing the search report to a date not later than 1 month before the deferred date of grant of the patent.

subsection.leadIn: If a filing fee or an advertisement fee payable under section 113(5) of the Ordinance is not paid within the time limit specified in that section, it is to be regarded as having been paid within the time limit if it is paid, with an additional fee, within a grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is allowed by the Registrar by a notice given to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: begins on the date of expiry of the time limit; and
ends at the expiry of 1 month after the date of the notice.

section.name: s68B
section.heading: Restoration of priority right under section 110A of Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies to a restoration application under section 110A of the Ordinance in relation to the priority right of a subsequent short-term patent application referred to in section 110A(1)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A restoration application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: a statement of priority referred to in section 111(1) of the Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to establish why the subsequent short-term patent application was not filed before the expiry of the period of 12 months referred to in section 110(1A) of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to satisfy the Registrar that all reasonable care required by the circumstances of the case has been taken for the purposes of section 110A(5) of the Ordinance; and
the prescribed fee for the restoration application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: filed with the Registrar.

subsection.content: If the restoration application is not accompanied by the evidence required by subsection (2)(b)(ii), the Registrar must specify a period within which the evidence must be filed with the Registrar.
If there is any deficiency in the statement of priority filed, the Registrar must specify a period within which the deficiency must be corrected.

subsection.leadIn: The restoration application is to be regarded as being withdrawn if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the evidence is not filed within the period specified under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deficiency is not corrected within the period specified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar approves the restoration application, the following documents must be filed with the Registrar within a period specified by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the patent application on the basis of which the priority right is restored (previous application); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of the certificate (certificate) that—

subparagraph.content: is issued by the authority that received the previous application; and
states the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.content: If the previous application is a Hong Kong application as defined by section 108A of the Ordinance, the copy of the previous application and the copy of the certificate are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: If the previous application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(1) and (2) of these Rules apply to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may make a requirement under section 56B(5) of these Rules in relation to it.

subsection.content: If a copy of the previous application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(1), (2) and (5) of these Rules as applied by subsection (8) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Claiming priority under section 111 of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 69A of these Rules, this section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant of a short-term patent application (subsequent application) claims priority of a non-Hong Kong application or Hong Kong application (previous application) under section 111 of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the subsequent application is within 12 months after the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must file with the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of priority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents referred to in subsection (7).

subsection.content: A statement of priority must be filed with the Registrar in the specified form together with the subsequent application.
Despite subsection (3), if the conditions specified in subsection (5) are met, the statement of priority may be filed within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statement of priority is accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: preparations for publication of the specification of the short-term patent under section 118(2)(a) of the Ordinance have not been completed.

subsection.leadIn: The statement of priority must state the following particulars of the previous application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of filing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the country, territory or area in or for which the previous application was made.

subsection.leadIn: The following documents must be filed with the Registrar within 16 months after the earliest date of priority claimed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the previous application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of the certificate (certificate) that—

subparagraph.content: is issued by the authority that received the previous application; and
states the date of filing of the previous application.

subsection.content: If the previous application is a Hong Kong application, the copy of the previous application and the copy of the certificate are to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: If the previous application or the certificate is in neither English nor Chinese—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(1) and (2) of these Rules apply to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar may make a requirement under section 56B(5) of these Rules in relation to it.

subsection.content: If a copy of the previous application, a copy of the certificate or the translation required by sections 56(1), 56A and 56B(1), (2) and (5) of these Rules as applied by subsection (9) is available to the Registrar before the expiry of the period for filing the document under these Rules, it is to be regarded as having been filed in due time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Hong Kong application (香港申請) has the meaning given by section 108A of the Ordinance;
non-Hong Kong application (非香港申請) has the meaning given by section 108A of the Ordinance.

section.name: s69A
section.heading: Claiming priority for divisional short-term patent application

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an earlier short-term patent application referred to in section 116 of the Ordinance has been filed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant or the applicant’s successor in title files a new application referred to in that section that meets the conditions specified in that section.

subsection.content: A right of priority that has not been claimed for the earlier short-term patent application may not be claimed for the new application.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Claim regarding non-prejudicial disclosure under section 109(b) of Ordinance
section.leadIn: The following written evidence is prescribed for the purposes of section 109 of the Ordinance in relation to non-prejudicial disclosure as provided for under paragraph (b) of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate, issued by the authority responsible for holding the exhibition, stating— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the invention was displayed at the exhibition; and (L.N. 35 of 2019)
the date of the first disclosure of the invention at the exhibition; and (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an identification of the invention, duly authenticated by the authority.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Searching authority
section.leadIn: The following searching authorities are prescribed for the purposes of section 113(8)(a) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the patent offices designated for the purposes of the Ordinance under section 8 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Contents of search report
section.leadIn: A search report shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify by name the searching authority which prepared the report;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be dated and shall indicate the date on which the search was actually completed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the classification of the subject-matter according to the International Patent Classification;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: contain the citations of the documents considered to be relevant; and (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: list the classification identification of the fields searched. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s73
section.heading: Requirements concerning short-term patent application for invention requiring use of micro-organisms under section 149(2A) of Ordinance
section.content: Schedule 1 to these Rules has effect under section 149(2A) of the Ordinance in relation to a short-term patent application for an invention that requires the use of micro-organisms for the performance of the invention.

section.name: s73A
section.heading: Requirements concerning sequence listing in short-term patent application for invention involving nucleotide and amino acid sequences

subsection.content: A short-term patent application for an invention that involves nucleotide and amino acid sequences must contain a sequence listing as a part of the description in the specification contained in the application.

subsection.leadIn: A sequence listing must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements and standards adopted under the Patent Cooperation Treaty for the presentation of sequence listings in patent applications; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be filed—

subparagraph.content: with the Registrar; and
in electronic form, if so required by the Registrar.

subsection.content: A sequence listing filed in relation to a short-term patent application may be filed in electronic form even if the application is not filed by way of electronic filing under section 93A(2) of these Rules.

A sequence listing filed after the date of filing of the short-term patent application must be accompanied by a statement made by the applicant confirming to the satisfaction of the Registrar that the sequence listing does not contain any matter extending beyond the sequence disclosed in the application.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Divisional short-term patent application under section 116 of Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to section 122 of the Ordinance, a new short-term patent application within the meaning of section 116 of the Ordinance, may be filed at any time after the filing of the earlier application, except that a new application may not be filed after the earlier application has been refused, is withdrawn, or is regarded as being withdrawn. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

Where possible, the description and drawings of the earlier application and the new application shall relate only to the matter for which protection is sought by each such application; however, where it is necessary for an application to describe the matter for which protection is sought by reference to another application, such reference shall include the application number of that other application and shall indicate the matter for which protection is claimed in the other application.
A new application is to be regarded as duly filed on the earliest date on which the minimum requirement under section 114(3) of the Ordinance is complied with. (L.N. 35 of 2019; L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s74A
section.heading: Claim regarding non-prejudicial disclosure under section 109(a) of Ordinance
section.leadIn: A claim regarding a disclosure that was due to, or in consequence of, an evident abuse under section 109(a) of the Ordinance must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement stating that there has been an evident abuse as described in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: written evidence in support of the statement.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Request to amend short-term patent application before grant under section 120(1) of Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 45(3) of these Rules, a request to amend a short-term patent application before grant under section 120(1) of the Ordinance must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: identify the amendment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give the reasons for the amendment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant requests to amend the description, claims or drawings in the specification contained in a short-term patent application (requested amendment), the Registrar may, if the Registrar thinks fit, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to file the following copies of the amended specification (required copies) with the Registrar within the period specified by the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a clean copy of the specification with the requested amendment incorporated into it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the specification with the requested amendment incorporated into it and indicated in it.

subsection.content: If the required copies are not filed within the period specified under subsection (2), the request for amendment to which the required copies relate is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), the amendment of the short-term patent application must be prepared in compliance with the requirements specified in sections 58(2) and (3), 59, 60, 61, 62(2) to (12), 63 and 64 of these Rules. (L.N. 90 of 2025)
The Registrar may, by notice given to the applicant, require the applicant to correct any deficiencies in the requested amendment within the period specified in the notice.

If the deficiencies mentioned in the notice are not corrected within the period specified by the Registrar under subsection (5), the request to amend the short-term patent application is to be regarded as being withdrawn.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Notice requesting reinstatement of an application for a short-term patent under section 123 of Ordinance
section.content: A notice under section 123 of the Ordinance requesting reinstatement of an application for a short-term patent shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the additional prescribed fee.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Application for restoration of rights in relation to an application for a short-term patent under section 123 of Ordinance
section.content: An application under section 123 of the Ordinance for restoration of rights lost in relation to an application for a short-term patent shall be in the specified form and shall be accompanied by the additional prescribed fee.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Short-term patent application based on international application under section 125 of Ordinance

subsection.content: The other date referred to in section 125(2) of the Ordinance is any date within 6 months after the date of issuance of an official notification by the China National Intellectual Property Administration stating that the international application has entered the national phase in the China National Intellectual Property Administration.
An application to which subsection (1) applies must be accompanied by a copy of the official notification issued by the China National Intellectual Property Administration.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Provisions on Short-term Patents after Grant

section.name: s79
section.heading: Renewal of short-term patents

subsection.content: Payment of the renewal fee prescribed for the purposes of section 126(2) or (3) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing a request for renewal in the specified form accompanied by the renewal fee.
On receipt of the request for renewal duly completed and renewal fee, the Registrar shall issue a confirmation of payment.

Where the period for payment of a renewal fee pursuant to section 126(2) or (3) of the Ordinance has expired, the Registrar shall, not later than 6 weeks after the last date for payment under that section and if the fee still remains unpaid, send to the proprietor of the short-term patent a notice reminding him that payment is overdue and of the consequences of non-payment.

subsection.leadIn: Notice to a proprietor under subsection (3) shall be sent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any address in Hong Kong notified by the proprietor for that purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no address has been so notified, the address for service entered in the register.

subsection.content: The late payment of a renewal fee in the manner provided for in section 126(5) of the Ordinance shall be made by filing a request for renewal in the specified form accompanied by the renewal fee and any additional fee prescribed for the purposes of that subsection.

section.name: s79A
section.heading: Observations by third parties

subsection.content: This section applies to a notice referred to in section 126A(1) of the Ordinance of a person’s observations on the patentability of an invention that is the subject of a short-term patent.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must be filed with the Registrar during the following period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the date on which the short-term patent is granted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: before the earliest of the following dates—

subparagraph.content: the date on which the Registrar issues the certificate of substantive examination in respect of the short-term patent;
the date on which the Registrar gives a notice in relation to the short-term patent under section 81I(5), 81K(4), 81M(4) or 81N(2) of these Rules; (L.N. 90 of 2025)

the date on which the short-term patent is found by the court to be wholly valid in any proceedings in which the validity of the patent is contested that are mentioned in section 127B(4)(b) of the Ordinance;
if the short-term patent has not been subsequently restored under section 127 of the Ordinance—the date on which the short-term patent has ceased to have effect under section 126 of the Ordinance;
the end of the period referred to in section 126(1)(b) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Section 126A(3) of the Ordinance does not apply to a notice that, in the opinion of the Registrar, would—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disparage any person in a way likely to damage the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be generally expected to encourage any offensive, immoral or anti-social behaviour.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Notification of lapsed short-term patent
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a short-term patent has ceased to have effect because a renewal fee has not been paid within the period prescribed for the purposes of section 126(2) or (3) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extended period specified in section 126(5) of the Ordinance has expired without the renewal and prescribed additional fee under that subsection having been paid,

section.continued: the Registrar shall, within 6 weeks after the expiration of the extended period, notify the proprietor of the short-term patent of the fact and draw his attention to the provisions of section 127 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Restoration of lapsed short-term patents under section 127 of Ordinance
