(L.N. 90 of 2025)
If a fee is paid in error or in excess of the amount specified in Schedule 2, the Registrar must refund the amount paid in error or the excess amount accordingly. (L.N. 90 of 2025)

section.name: s104A
section.heading: Stay of proceedings

subsection.content: The Registrar may, if the Registrar considers it appropriate to do so, stay any proceedings before the Registrar involving 2 or more parties on any term that the Registrar considers appropriate.
The Registrar may do so either on the initiative of the Registrar or on request of a party to those proceedings.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Transitional provision relating to the Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2004
section.content: The amendments to sections 3, 4, 6, 7, 35, 37, 40, 41, 48 and 108 of these Rules effected by sections 4, 5, 6, 12, 13, 16, 17, 21 and 39 of the Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2004 (L.N. 37 of 2004) do not apply to proceedings pending before the Registrar on the commencement* of those sections, which proceedings shall continue as if those amendments had not been made.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2019

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), these Rules as in force immediately before the commencement date* of the Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2019 (L.N. 35 of 2019) (Amendment Rules) continue to apply to proceedings before the Registrar that are pending immediately before that date as if the Amendment Rules had not been made. (E.R. 4 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: Schedule 2 to these Rules as amended by the Amendment Rules applies to a fee that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out in that Schedule as in force immediately before the commencement date* of the Amendment Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payable before that date, but is paid on or after that date.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2025

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the amendments to these Rules effected by the Amendment Rules (amendments) do not apply to proceedings that are pending before the Registrar on the commencement date (pending proceedings), and the pending proceedings are to continue as if the amendments had not been made.

subsection.leadIn: If, on or after the commencement date, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decides to refer any pending proceedings to the court for determination under section 44(5), 48(4), 49(2)(b), 127E(3) or 133(1)(b) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives written notice of the decision under section 37A(2), 40A(2), 41AAI(2), 81W(2), 92A(2) or 92B(2) of these Rules,

subsection.continued: the amendments apply to the pending proceedings after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Amendment Rules (《修訂規則》) means the Patents (General) (Amendment) Rules 2025;
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the Amendment Rules come into operation.

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: application for a patent (專利的申請) and patent application (專利申請) mean a standard patent (O) application or short-term patent application;
patent (專利) means a standard patent (O) or short-term patent.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Application

subsection.leadIn: If an invention which is the subject of a patent application or patent requires for its performance the use of a micro-organism— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is not available to the public at the date of filing of the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which cannot be described in the application or the specification of the patent in such a manner as to enable the invention to be performed by a person skilled in the art,

subsection.continued: the invention is to be regarded, in relation to the micro-organism itself, as being disclosed for the purposes of section 77 of the Ordinance if the conditions set out in subparagraph (2) are satisfied. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subparagraph (1) are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the name of the depositary institution, the date when the culture was deposited and the accession number of the deposit are given in the specification of the application;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: where a new deposit is made under paragraph 3, the applicant or proprietor makes a new deposit in accordance with that paragraph.

subsection.leadIn:
For a short-term patent application, the
information specified in subparagraph (2)(b) shall be submitted— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: together with the request for grant of a short-term patent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 1 month after the Registrar has informed the applicant that a request referred to in section 147(5) of the Ordinance has been made, (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: For a standard patent (O) application, if the information specified in subparagraph (2)(b) is not submitted at the time the application is filed, it must be submitted on or before the earliest of the following time— (L.N. 90 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the expiry of 16 months after—

subparagraph.content: if priority has been claimed—the date of priority claimed; or
if priority has not been claimed—the date of filing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a request is made under section 37Q(2) of the Ordinance—the date of the request;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the expiry of 1 month after the Registrar has informed the applicant that a request referred to in section 147(4) of the Ordinance has been made. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.content: For a patent application, the applicant is, on giving the information specified in subparagraph (2)(b) in the specification of the application, to be regarded as having also given the specified consent under paragraph 1B. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

section.name: s1B
section.heading: Specified consent

subsection.leadIn: A specified consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is the consent of an applicant of a patent application to make a deposited culture available to—

subparagraph.content: an entitled person after the information specified in paragraph 1(2)(b) is given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is unconditional and irrevocable; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is subject to—

subparagraph.content: the production of the Registrar’s confirmation notice regarding the release to the person who is named in the confirmation notice as a person to whom the culture may be made available; and
the making of a valid request for the culture to be made available to the depositary institution with which the culture is deposited.

subsection.leadIn: In subparagraph (1)—
subsection.def: deposited culture (寄存的培養物) includes a deposited culture that is treated under paragraph 3(2) as having always been available;

def.name: EntitledPerson
def.leadIn: entitled person (具有權利的人) means a person who has the right to make a request in the circumstances specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a standard patent (O) application—section 147(4) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a short-term patent application—section 147(5) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Availability of cultures

subsection.content: A request to the Registrar for the issue of a confirmation notice regarding the release of a deposited culture shall be in the specified form. (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn:
The Registrar shall send a copy of the form lodged with him under subparagraph (1) and of his confirmation notice
regarding the release of the sample— (L.N. 37 of 2004; L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the applicant for, or proprietor of, the patent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the depositary institution; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to the person making the request.

subsection.leadIn: A request under subparagraph (1) shall comprise, on the part of the person making the request, undertakings for the benefit of the applicant for, or proprietor of, the patent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to make the culture, or any culture derived from it, available to any other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to use the culture, or any culture derived from it, otherwise than for experimental purposes relating to the subject-matter of the invention,

subsection.continued: and, in this subparagraph, references to a culture derived from a deposited culture of a micro-organism are references to a culture so derived which exhibits those characteristics of the deposited culture essential for the performance of the invention.

subsection.leadIn: Further to subparagraph (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: and subject to sub-subparagraph (c), both undertakings shall have effect during any period before the application for a patent has been withdrawn, is to be regarded as being withdrawn or has been refused;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a patent is granted on the application, the undertaking set out in subparagraph (3)(a) shall also have effect during any period for which the patent is in force and during the further period of 6 months referred to in section 39(4) or 126(5) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the undertaking set out in subparagraph (3)(b) shall not have effect after the date of publication in the official journal of a notice advertising that the patent has been granted. (2 of 2001 s. 19; L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The period referred to in subparagraph (4)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is a period that has been altered under section 94 of these Rules or for which an extended period has been granted under section 100AA, 100AAB, 100AAC or 100AAD of these Rules—includes such altered period and extended period but does not include the period before the alteration or the grant of the extension; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an application is reinstated under section 28 of the Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD or 123 of the Ordinance—does not include the period between the withdrawal, deemed withdrawal or refusal (as the case requires) and the reinstatement of the application. (L.N. 35 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of enabling any Government use specified in section 69 of the Ordinance in relation to the culture, the undertakings specified in subparagraph (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not be required from any Government department or person authorized in writing by a Government department for the purposes of this paragraph; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not have effect in relation to any such person who has already given the undertakings.

subsection.content: An undertaking given pursuant to subparagraph (3) may be varied by way of derogation by agreement between the applicant or proprietor and the person by whom it is given.

Where, in respect of a patent to which the undertaking set out in subparagraph (3)(a) has effect, a compulsory licence is granted under section 64 of the Ordinance, that undertaking shall not have effect to the extent necessary for effect to be given to any such licence. (E.R. 4 of 2020)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Making cultures available only to experts

subsection.content: This paragraph and paragraphs 2B, 2C, 2D and 2E do not affect the rights of the Government or any person authorized in writing by a public officer under section 69 of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: This paragraph and paragraphs 2B, 2C, 2D and 2E apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before preparations for publication of a patent application under one of the following provisions have been completed—

subparagraph.content: for a standard patent (O) application—section 37Q(1)(a) of the Ordinance;
for a short-term patent application—section 118(2)(a) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant for the patent has, by notice filed with the Registrar in the specified form, notified the Registrar of the intention of the applicant that the sample of micro-organism should be made available only to an expert.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant files the notice, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of publication of the standard patent (O) application under section 37Q(1)(a) of the Ordinance or the short-term patent under section 118(2)(a) of the Ordinance, advertise in the official journal that the provisions of this paragraph have effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: despite paragraph 2, not issue any confirmation notice regarding the release of a deposited culture otherwise than under paragraph 2E until—

subparagraph.content: the patent is granted; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: withdrawn;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: regarded as being withdrawn; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: refused.

section.name: s2B
section.heading: Request to make cultures available to experts

subsection.content: If a notice is filed under paragraph 2A(2), any person may request the Registrar to make the sample of micro-organism available to an expert (requester).

subsection.leadIn: The request must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nominate the expert to whom the requester wishes the sample to be made available;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: set out the particulars and the credentials of the expert;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by the undertakings of the expert made for the benefit of the applicant for, or the proprietor of, the patent—

subparagraph.content: not to make the sample, or any sample derived from it, available to any other person; and
not to use the sample, or any sample derived from it, otherwise than for experimental purposes relating to the subject matter of the invention; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: be filed with the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: An undertaking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: referred to in subparagraph (2)(d) has effect, subject to sub-subparagraph (c), during any period before the patent application has been withdrawn, is to be regarded as being withdrawn or has been refused;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: referred to in subparagraph (2)(d)(i) also has effect, if a patent is granted on the application, during any period for which the patent is in force and during the further period of 6 months referred to in section 39(4) or 126(5) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: referred to in subparagraph (2)(d)(ii) does not have effect after the date of publication in the official journal of a notice advertising the grant of the patent.

subsection.leadIn: The period referred to in subparagraph (3)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is a period that has been altered under section 94 of these Rules or for which an extended period has been granted under section 100AA, 100AAB, 100AAC or 100AAD of these Rules—includes such altered period and extended period but does not include the period before the alteration or the grant of the extension; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an application is reinstated under section 28 of the Ordinance as applied by section 37ZD or 123 of the Ordinance—does not include the period between the withdrawal, deemed withdrawal or refusal (as the case requires) and the reinstatement of the application.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of enabling any Government use specified in section 69 of the Ordinance in relation to the culture, the undertakings referred to in subparagraph (2)(d)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: do not have effect in relation to the expert who made the undertakings.

subsection.leadIn: An undertaking referred to in subparagraph (2)(d) may be varied by way of derogation by agreement between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant or proprietor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expert who made the undertaking.

subsection.content: If, in respect of a patent to which an undertaking referred to in subparagraph (2)(d) relates, a compulsory licence is granted under section 64 of the Ordinance, the undertaking does not have effect to the extent necessary for the licence to have effect.

section.name: s2C
section.heading: Applicant may file opposition notice

subsection.leadIn: If a request is filed under paragraph 2B, the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the request to the applicant for the patent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify a period within which the applicant may file an opposition notice to oppose the request.

subsection.content: The Registrar may extend the period specified under subparagraph (1)(b) if, before its expiry, the applicant makes a request to the Registrar to extend the period.

section.name: s2D
section.heading: Opposition notice

subsection.content: An applicant for a patent who intends to oppose a request filed under paragraph 2B may file an opposition notice within the period specified under paragraph 2C(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The opposition notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of opposition to releasing a sample of micro-organism to the expert; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be filed with the Registrar.

subsection.content: An applicant who files an opposition notice must, at the same time, send a copy of it to the requester referred to in paragraph 2B(1).

section.name: s2E
section.heading: Confirmation notice in favour of expert

subsection.leadIn: If an opposition notice is filed in accordance with paragraph 2D(1) and (2), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: if the Registrar decides to issue a confirmation notice in favour of the expert—send a copy of the request filed under paragraph 2B and the confirmation notice to—

subparagraph.content: the applicant for the patent;
the depositary institution;
the requester referred to in paragraph 2B(1); and
the expert; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Registrar decides not to issue a confirmation notice—notify the requester and the applicant of the decision in writing.

subsection.content: If the Registrar notifies the requester under subparagraph (1)(c), the requester may nominate another expert under paragraph 2B.

subsection.leadIn: If no opposition notice is filed in accordance with paragraph 2D(1) and (2), the Registrar must send a copy of the request and the confirmation notice to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the depositary institution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the requester; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the expert.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on the initiative of the Registrar or on application of a party to the proceedings, give directions that the Registrar thinks fit with regard to any part of the procedure including the subsequent procedure to be followed.

section.name: s3
section.heading: New deposits

subsection.leadIn: Where the depositary institution with which a deposit or a new deposit of a culture has been made under this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notifies the applicant or proprietor that it—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: cannot satisfy a request made in accordance with paragraph 2(1) or 2B(1); or (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is not able lawfully, to satisfy such a request, for the culture to be made available;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases temporarily or permanently to carry out the functions of a depositary institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ceases for any reason to conduct its activities as a depositary institution in an objective and impartial manner,

subsection.continued: then subject to subparagraph (3), the applicant or proprietor may, unless the culture has been transferred to another depositary institution which is able to make it available, make a new deposit of a culture of that micro-organism.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph 1 and of this paragraph, the deposit shall be treated as always having been available if, within 3 months of the receipt of such notification or of the depositary institution ceasing to perform the functions of a depositary institution or to conduct its activities as such an institution in an objective and impartial manner, the applicant or proprietor— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case where the deposit has not already been transferred, makes the new deposit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnishes to the depositary institution with which the new deposit is made a declaration that the culture so deposited is of the same micro-organism as was the culture originally deposited; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: requests amendment of the specification under the Ordinance so as to indicate the accession number of the transferred or new deposit and, where applicable, the name of the depositary institution with which the deposit has been made. (L.N. 35 of 2019; L.N. 90 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: The new deposit referred to in subparagraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall, except as provided in sub-subparagraph (b), be made with the same depositary institution as was the original deposit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the cases referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii), (b) and (c), shall be made with another depositary institution which is able to satisfy the request.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: international depositary authority (國際寄存主管當局) means an institution which has acquired the status of international depositary authority as provided in Article 7 of the Budapest Treaty; (L.N. 35 of 2019; E.R. 4 of 2020)

the Budapest Treaty (《布達佩斯條約》) means the Treaty on the International Recognition of the Deposit of Micro-organisms for the purposes of Patent Procedure done at Budapest in 1977 as revised or amended from time to time. (L.N. 35 of 2019; E.R. 4 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule a depositary institution is— (L.N. 35 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an international depositary authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an institution that at all relevant times—

subparagraph.content: performs the functions of receiving, accepting and storing micro-organism and furnishing samples of micro-organism; and
conducts its affairs in so far as they relate to those functions in an objective and impartial manner. (L.N. 35 of 2019)
